  <td width="96%" colspan="8" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:96.44%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Check box if any part of the fee is offset as
  provided by Exchange Act Rule&nbsp;0-11(a)(2)&nbsp;and identify the
  filing for which the offsetting fee was paid previously. Identify the
  previous filing by registration statement number, or the Form&nbsp;or
  Schedule and the date of its filing.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="3%" colspan="4" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.92%;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableFull --><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading --></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="92%" colspan="4" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:92.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Amount Previously Paid:</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="251" height="91" src="g75131bci001.gif" alt="GRAPHIC"></font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="5" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:16.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS&nbsp;INC.</font></b></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="58%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:58.48%;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableFull --><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading -->LOUIS C. CAMILLERI<br>
  CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD</p>
  </td>
  <td width="41%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.52%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">THREE LAKES DRIVE<br>
  NORTHFIELD, IL 60093</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="58%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:58.48%;">
  <p style="margin:3.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="41%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.52%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:3.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">March&nbsp;13,
  2007</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dear Fellow Stockholder:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You are invited to attend the 2007 Annual Meeting of
Stockholders of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. We will hold the Annual Meeting at 9:00&nbsp;a.m.
EDT on Tuesday, April&nbsp;24, 2007, at the Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc.
Robert&nbsp;M. Schaeberle Technology Center, 188&nbsp;River Road, East Hanover,
New Jersey. The map and driving instructions to the Robert&nbsp;M. Schaeberle
Technology Center are printed on the back of the attached Proxy Statement.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At the Annual Meeting, stockholders will elect
directors and vote on the ratification of the selection of independent
auditors. We will also report on the Company&#146;s business. Stockholders will have
an opportunity to ask relevant questions.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Only stockholders of
record at the close of business on February&nbsp;28, 2007 are entitled to
notice of, to attend, and to vote at the Annual Meeting.</font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If you would like to attend the Annual Meeting you
MUST submit your request by sending an e-mail to corporate.secretary@kraft.com,
by faxing your request to the Corporate Secretary at 847-646-2753,
or by sending a letter to the Corporate Secretary, Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc., Three
Lakes Drive, Northfield, Illinois 60093. <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">If
your shares are not registered in your name, you must also send evidence of
your stock ownership on February&nbsp;28, 2007 with your request</u></b>.
You can obtain this evidence from your bank or brokerage firm. In addition, if
you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, please bring government-issued
photographic identification.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The meeting facilities will open at 7:30&nbsp;a.m.
EDT. The Annual Meeting will begin at 9:00&nbsp;a.m. EDT. Please arrive early
to facilitate your registration and security clearance. If you will need
special assistance at the Annual Meeting, please include this information in
your admission request to the Corporate Secretary.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For your comfort and security,
we will not allow any packages, briefcases, large pocketbooks or bags into the
Annual Meeting. We also do not allow cellular and digital phones, audio tape
recorders, laptops, video and still cameras, pagers, and pets, other than
assistance animals for the disabled.</font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Attached you will find a Notice of Meeting and Proxy
Statement that contains additional information about the Annual Meeting,
including the methods that you can use to vote your Proxy.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Your vote is important to us.
I encourage you to sign and return your proxy card, or use telephone or
Internet voting prior to the Annual Meeting, so that your shares of common
stock will be represented and voted at the Annual Meeting even if you cannot
attend.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="53%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:53.58%;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableFull --><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading --></p>
  </td>
  <td width="46%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sincerely,</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="100%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:100.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="223" height="140" src="g75131bci002.gif" alt="GRAPHIC"></font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="100%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-top:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:100.0%;">

  please call 1-866-655-7238.</font></b></p>
  </td>

  </td>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="167" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:125.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:25.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="472" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:353.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="167" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:125.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">WHO CAN VOTE:</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="505" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:378.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You can vote if you were a stockholder of record on
  February&nbsp;28, 2007.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="167" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:125.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  </td>
 </tr>

  </td>
  <td width="505" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:378.7pt;">

  </td>

  <td width="620" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:464.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#RatificationOfTheSelectionOfIndep_193758" title="Click to goto ">Ratification of the Selection of Independent Auditors</a></font></p>

<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="5" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:16.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS&nbsp;INC.<a name="KraftFoodsinc__184304"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">Three Lakes Drive<a name="ThreeLakesDrive_184304"></a><br>
Northfield, Illinois 60093<a name="NorthfieldIllinois60093_184304"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">March&nbsp;13, 2007</font></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="128" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:96.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">PROXY STATEMENT<a name="ProxyStatement_184304"></a><br>
FOR 2007 ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS<a name="For2007AnnualMeetingOfStockholder_184305"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:11.0pt;">TO BE HELD ON APRIL&nbsp;24, 2007<a name="ToBeHeldOnApril242007_184305"></a></font></b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="128" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:96.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">GENERAL
INFORMATION<a name="GeneralInformation_184305"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b>WHEN AND WHERE
IS THE ANNUAL MEETING?<a name="a1_WhenAndWhereIsTheAnnualMeeting_184305"></a></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The 2007
Annual Meeting of Stockholders of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. will be held on April&nbsp;24,
2007 at 9:00&nbsp;a.m.&nbsp;EDT, at the Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. Robert&nbsp;M.
Schaeberle Technology Center, 188 River Road, East Hanover, New Jersey.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2</font></b>.<font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b>WHY AM I
RECEIVING THESE MATERIALS?<a name="a2_WhyAmIReceivingTheseMaterials_184305"></a></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board is soliciting your
proxy for use at the 2007 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of Kraft
Foods&nbsp;Inc. or at any adjournment or postponements of the Annual Meeting. The
Board is providing these proxy solicitation materials to give you information
for use in determining how &#160;to vote in
connection with the Annual Meeting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company began mailing the proxy solicitation materials on or around March&nbsp;22,
2007 to all stockholders entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font></b></font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHAT
PROPOSALS ARE BEING PRESENTED FOR STOCKHOLDER VOTE AT THE ANNUAL MEETING?<a name="a3_WhatProposalsAreBeingPresented_184305"></a></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Two proposals are scheduled
for vote at the Annual Meeting:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 1.
Election of Directors: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS (THE &#147;BOARD&#148;) UNANIMOUSLY
RECOMMENDS THAT YOU VOTE FOR ITS NOMINEES: AJAY BANGA, JAN BENNINK, LOUIS C.
CAMILLERI, MARK D. KETCHUM, RICHARD A. LERNER, M.D., JOHN C. POPE, IRENE B.
ROSENFELD, MARY L. SCHAPIRO, AND DEBORAH C. WRIGHT, FOR TERMS EXPIRING APRIL
2008.<a name="Item1_ElectionOfDirectorsTheBoard_185002"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You can find information about
the Board&#146;s nominees, as well as information about the Board, its committees,
director compensation, and other related matters beginning on page&nbsp;8.<a name="YouCanFindInformationAboutTheBoar_185007"></a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 2.
Ratification of Appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP: THE BOARD
UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS THAT YOU VOTE FOR THIS PROPOSAL TO RATIFY THE
APPOINTMENT OF PRICEWATERHOUSECOOPERS LLP AS INDEPENDENT AUDITOR FOR THE YEAR
2007.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You can
find information about the Company&#146;s relationship with PricewaterhouseCoopers
LLP beginning on page&nbsp;18.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">4.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b>WHAT OTHER
MATTERS MAY&nbsp;ARISE AT THE ANNUAL MEETING?<a name="a4_WhatOtherMattersMayariseAtTheA_184306"></a></b></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We do not know of any other
matters that will come before the stockholders at the Annual Meeting. The
Chairman of the Annual Meeting may refuse to allow presentation of a proposal
or a nomination for the Board from the floor of the Annual Meeting if the
proposal or nomination was not properly submitted. The requirements for
properly submitting proposals and nominations from the floor of the Annual
Meeting for this year&#146;s meeting were described in the Company&#146;s 2006 Proxy
Statement and are similar to those described on page&nbsp;65 for next year&#146;s
meeting.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">1</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='1',FILE='C:\fc\7120318528_D11189_1851620\7513-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 20:32 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHAT
IS A PROXY?<a name="a5_WhatIsAProxy_184306"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">It is your legal designation of another person to vote
the stock you own. That other person is called a proxy. If you designate
someone as your proxy in a written document, that written document also is
called a proxy or, alternatively, a proxy card.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If you
deliver a properly executed written proxy, or submit a properly completed proxy
by telephone or over the Internet, that proxy will be voted at the Annual
Meeting in accordance with the directions given in the proxy, unless you revoke
the proxy before the Annual Meeting. The proxies also may be voted at any
adjournments or postponements of the Annual Meeting.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">6.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHO
WILL BEAR THE COST OF SOLICITING VOTES FOR THE ANNUAL MEETING?<a name="a6_WhoWillBearTheCostOfSoliciting_184306"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company will bear the cost
of this solicitation of proxies. In addition to the use of the mail, some of
the officers and regular employees of the Company may solicit proxies by
telephone and will request brokerage houses, banks, and other custodians,
nominees, and fiduciaries to forward soliciting material to the beneficial
owners of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock held of record by such persons. The Company
will reimburse such persons for expenses incurred in forwarding such soliciting
material. Additional solicitation of proxies may be made in the same manner
under the engagement and direction of D.F. King&nbsp;&amp; Co.,&nbsp;Inc., 48
Wall Street, New York, New York 10005, at an anticipated cost of $7,000, plus
reimbursement of out-of-pocket expenses.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">VOTING MECHANICS<a name="VotingMechanics_184307"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">7.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHO
IS ENTITLED TO VOTE AT THE ANNUAL MEETING?<a name="a7_WhoIsEntitledToVoteAtTheAnnual_184307"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Only stockholders of record of shares of the Company&#146;s
common stock at the close of business on February&nbsp;28, 2007 (the &#147;record
date&#148;) are entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting, or at adjournments or
postponements of the Annual Meeting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Each stockholder of record of Class&nbsp;A Common
Stock and Class&nbsp;B Common Stock on the record date is entitled to vote on
all matters to come before the Annual Meeting. Holders of Class&nbsp;A Common
Stock will be entitled to one vote for each share held. Holders of Class&nbsp;B
Common Stock will be entitled to ten votes for each share held.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;28,
2007, 459,617,005 shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock were outstanding, of
which Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Altria Group&#148;) held 276,449,240. On February&nbsp;28,
2007, Altria Group held all of the 1,180,000,000 shares of Class&nbsp;B Common
Stock that were outstanding.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">8.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHAT
IS THE RECORD DATE AND WHAT DOES IT MEAN?<a name="a8_WhatIsTheRecordDateAndWhatDoes_184307"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As required by Virginia
law and the Company&#146;s By-Laws, our Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) established
February&nbsp;28, 2007 as the record date for the 2006 Annual Meeting of
Stockholders. Stockholders of record (registered stockholders and street name
holders) at the close of business on the record date are entitled to:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Receive notice of the
Annual Meeting; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Attend
and vote at the Annual Meeting and any adjournments or postponements of the
Annual Meeting.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HOW
CAN I VOTE MY SHARES OF COMMON STOCK?<a name="a9_HowCanIVoteMySharesOfCommonSto_184307"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There are four ways to vote:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Over the Internet:</font></i>
If you are a registered stockholder, you can vote over the Internet, at <i>www.investorvote.com/kraft.</i> The Internet voting procedures,
including the use of control numbers, are designed to authenticate stockholders&#146;
identities, to allow stockholders to vote their shares, and to confirm that
their instructions have been properly recorded. The Internet voting system is
available 24 hours a day until 11:59&nbsp;p.m. (EDT), April&nbsp;23, 2007. Your
vote by the Internet must be received by 11:59&nbsp;p.m. (EDT), April&nbsp;23,
2007. If you are a street name holder, you may vote over the Internet if your
bank or broker makes </p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">2</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\fc\7120318528_D11189_1851620\7513-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 20:32 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">that method available to you by enclosing instructions
with the proxy statement that your bank or broker sends to you.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">By Telephone:</font></i> If
you are a registered stockholder, you can vote by touchtone telephone from the
United States and Canada, using the toll-free telephone number 1-800-652-8683.
The telephone voting procedures, including the use of control numbers, are
designed to authenticate stockholders&#146; identities, to allow stockholders to
vote their shares, and to confirm that their instructions have been properly
recorded. The telephone voting system is available 24 hours a day until 11:59&nbsp;p.m.
(EDT), April&nbsp;23, 2007. Your vote by telephone must be received by 11:59&nbsp;p.m.
(EDT), April&nbsp;23, 2007. If you are a street name holder, you may vote by
telephone if your bank or broker makes that method available to you by
enclosing instructions with the proxy statement that your bank or broker sends
to you.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">In Writing:</font></i> You
can vote by mailing your completed proxy card (if you are a registered
stockholder) or your completed vote instruction form (if you are a street name
holder). Your vote by mail must be received before the close of voting at the
Annual Meeting on April&nbsp;24, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">In Person:</font></i> All registered stockholders may
vote in person at the Annual Meeting. If your shares are held in street name,
you must request a legal proxy from your bank, broker or other nominee that
holds your shares and present that proxy in order to vote at the Annual
Meeting.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">10.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HOW
CAN I REVOKE A PROXY OR CHANGE MY VOTING INSTRUCTIONS?<a name="a10_HowCanIRevokeAProxyOrChangeMy_184308"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You can revoke a proxy
before the close of voting at the Annual Meeting by:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Entering new
instructions on either the Internet or telephone voting systems before 11:59&nbsp;p.m.
(EDT), April&nbsp;23, 2007;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Submitting a new
proxy card bearing a date later than your last proxy card. We must receive your
new proxy card before the close of voting at the Annual Meeting on April&nbsp;24,
2007;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Giving written
notice to the Corporate Secretary of the Company. Send that notice to Carol J.
Ward, Vice President and Corporate Secretary, Kraft Foods Inc., Three Lakes
Drive, Northfield, Illinois 60093. Your letter should contain the name in which
your shares are registered, the date of the proxy you want to revoke or change,
your new voting instructions, if applicable, and your signature. She must
receive your letter before the close of voting at the Annual Meeting on April&nbsp;24,
2007; or</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Attending the
Annual Meeting and voting in person (or by personal representative with an
appropriate proxy).</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">11.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHAT
IF I DO NOT SPECIFY A CHOICE FOR A MATTER WHEN RETURNING A PROXY?</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You should specify your
choice for each matter on the enclosed proxy card. However, if you give no
specific instructions, but sign and return the proxy card, your shares will be
voted FOR the election of all director nominees, and FOR the proposal to ratify
the selection of independent auditors.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">12.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b>WHAT DOES IT
MEAN IF I RECEIVE MORE THAN ONE PROXY CARD?<a name="a12_WhatDoesItMeanIfIReceiveMoreT_184309"></a></b></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">It means that you have
multiple accounts with brokers, banks, and/or our transfer agent. Please vote
all of these shares. We recommend that you contact your broker, bank, and/or
our transfer agent to consolidate as many accounts as possible under one name
and address. Our transfer agent is Computershare Trust Company, N.A., P.O.&nbsp;Box&nbsp;43069,
Providence, RI 02940. You can reach Computershare Trust Company at 1-866-655-7238
(from within the United States and Canada) or 1-781-575-3500
(from outside the United States and Canada).</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">3</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\fc\7120318528_D11189_1851620\7513-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 20:32 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SHARES HELD IN STREET
NAME<a name="SharesHeldInStreetName_184309"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">13.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHAT IS THE
DIFFERENCE BETWEEN A REGISTERED STOCKHOLDER AND A STOCKHOLDER WHO HOLDS STOCK
IN STREET NAME?</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If your shares of stock are registered in your name on the books and
records of our transfer agent, you are a registered stockholder. If your shares
of stock are held for you in the name of your broker or bank, your shares are
held in street name.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">14.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b>WILL MY SHARES
BE VOTED IF I DO NOT PROVIDE MY PROXY?<a name="a14_WillMySharesBeVotedIfIDoNotPr_184309"></a></b></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If your shares are held in street name, your shares
may be voted even if you do not provide the brokerage firm with voting
instructions. Under New York Stock Exchange (&#147;NYSE&#148;) rules, your broker may
vote shares held in street name on certain &#147;routine&#148; matters.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NYSE rules&nbsp;consider
the election of directors and the ratification of the selection of independent
auditors to be routine matters. As a result, your broker is permitted to vote
your shares at its discretion without instructions from you. When a proposal is
not a routine matter and the beneficial owner of shares has not provided voting
instructions to the brokerage firm with respect to that proposal, the brokerage
firm cannot vote the shares on that proposal. This is called a broker non-vote.
At this time, we do not have any other proposals to be voted on at the Annual
Meeting.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">15.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b>WHAT IS
HOUSEHOLDING?<a name="a15_WhatIsHouseholding_184309"></a></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If you and other residents at
your mailing address own shares of the Company&#146;s common stock in street names,
your broker or bank may have notified you that your household will receive only
one annual report and proxy statement for each company in which you hold stock
through that broker or bank. In this practice known as &#147;householding,&#148; you were
deemed to have consented to the process. Your broker or bank will send one copy
of our annual report and proxy statement to your address. Each stockholder will
continue to receive a separate proxy card or voting instruction card.
Householding benefits both you and the Company because it reduces the volume of
duplicate information received at your household and helps the Company to
reduce expenses.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SHARES HELD UNDER PLANS<a name="SharesHeldUnderPlans_184310"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">16.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHAT
DO I DO IF I&#146;M A CURRENT OR FORMER EMPLOYEE AND HAVE MONEY IN THE KRAFT STOCK
FUND OF THE KRAFT 401(k)&nbsp;PLAN?</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If you have money invested in the Kraft Stock Fund of
the Kraft 401(k)&nbsp;Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;), you do not actually own shares of
Kraft stock. The Plan Trustees do. Under the Plan, however, you have
pass-through voting rights based on your interest&#151;the amount of money you have
invested&#151;in the Kraft Stock Fund. You may exercise pass-through voting rights
in almost the same way that stockholders may vote their shares, but you have an
earlier deadline. If your voting instructions are received by April&nbsp;20,
2007, the Plan Trustees will submit a proxy that reflects your instructions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If you have money invested in the Kraft Stock Fund of
the Kraft 401(k)&nbsp;Plan and you do not give voting instructions (or give
them late), the Plan Trustees will vote your interest in the Kraft Stock Fund in
the same proportion as those plan shares for which instructions have been
received.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You may send your instructions to Computershare Trust
Company by using the mail (proxy card/voting instruction form), telephone or
Internet methods described on the proxy card/voting instruction form. Your
voting instructions will be kept confidential under the terms of the Plan. You
may not vote in person at the Annual Meeting.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">4</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\fc\7120318528_D11189_1851620\7513-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 20:32 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HOW
DO I VOTE IF MY SHARES ARE HELD BY COMPUTERSHARE IN MY EMPLOYEE STOCK ACCOUNT?</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 14.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employee
stock accounts maintained by Computershare Trust Company hold restricted stock
that has not yet vested, previously restricted stock that has vested, and
shares acquired through an option exercise. If you have these kinds of shares,
you should follow the instructions in Question 9 for voting shares held as a
record holder. Your proxy card reflects all shares held by Computershare Trust
Company in your employee stock account. You may vote your shares through the
Internet, by telephone, by mail or in person.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HOW
DO I VOTE IF I PARTICIPATE IN THE DIVIDEND REINVESTMENT PLAN?<a name="a18_HowDoIVoteIfIParticipateInThe_184310"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 14.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The proxy card you received
includes your dividend reinvestment plan shares. You may vote your shares
through the Internet, by telephone or by mail, all as described on the enclosed
proxy card/voting instruction card.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">VOTING
INFORMATION<a name="VotingInformation_184311"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHAT
ARE THE VOTING CHOICES WHEN VOTING ON ITEM 1, THE ELECTION OF DIRECTORS?</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stockholders
may:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Vote
FOR (in favor) of all nominees;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WITHHOLD
votes from all nominees; or</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 14.5pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WITHHOLD
votes from specific nominees.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">20.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHAT
VOTE IS NEEDED TO ELECT THE DIRECTORS?<a name="a20_WhatVoteIsNeededToElectTheDir_184311"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Directors
will be elected by a <i>plurality</i> of
the FOR votes cast, which means that the nine director nominees with the most
votes will be elected. As a result, if you WITHHOLD authority to vote for a
nominee, your vote will not be counted in determining the outcome of the
election of directors.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">21.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHAT
ARE THE VOTING CHOICES WHEN VOTING ON ITEM 2, THE RATIFICATION OF THE SELECTION
OF PRICEWATERHOUSECOOPERS LLP AS INDEPENDENT AUDITORS?</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stockholders
may:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Vote
FOR the ratification;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Vote
AGAINST the ratification; or</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>ABSTAIN
from voting on the ratification.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">22.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHAT
VOTE IS NEEDED TO RATIFY THE SELECTION OF PRICEWATERHOUSECOOPERS LLP AS
INDEPENDENT AUDITORS?</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 14.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The selection of the
independent auditors will be ratified if the votes cast FOR exceed the votes
cast AGAINST. In most cases abstentions are not included in vote totals, so
usually it does not affect the outcome of the vote. The ratification of the
selection of the independent auditors is an exception: if you ABSTAIN, your
shares will be counted as present at the Annual Meeting for purposes of determining
the presence or absence of the quorum and your abstention will have the same
effect as AGAINST votes on the ratification of appointment of
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as independent auditors.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">5</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\fc\7120318528_D11189_1851620\7513-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 20:32 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">23.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HOW
WILL VOTING ON OTHER BUSINESS BE CONDUCTED?<a name="a23_HowWillVotingOnOtherBusinessB_184312"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If any other matters are
properly presented for a vote, the people named as proxies will vote in
accordance with the recommendations of the Board of Directors.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ANNUAL
MEETING MECHANICS<a name="AnnualMeetingMechanics_184312"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">24.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HOW
MANY VOTES MUST BE PRESENT TO HOLD THE ANNUAL MEETING?<a name="a24_HowManyVotesMustBePresentToHo_184312"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In order to conduct the Annual
Meeting, a majority of our outstanding shares of common stock as of February&nbsp;28,
2007, must be present in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting. This is
referred to as a quorum. Abstentions and shares of record held by a broker or
its nominee (&#147;Broker Shares&#148;) that are voted on any matter are included in
determining the number of votes present. Broker Shares that are not voted on
any matter will not be included in determining whether a quorum is present.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25.</font></b></font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HOW
DO I OBTAIN ADMISSION TO THE ANNUAL MEETING?<a name="a25_HowDoIObtainAdmissionToTheAnn_184312"></a></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp; To obtain admission to
the Annual Meeting, you must be included in the attendees list. Because seating
is limited, you may bring only one guest. In addition, all meeting attendees
must present government-issued photographic identification at the Annual
Meeting. Please submit your request to be included in the attendees list by April&nbsp;17,
2007 by sending an e-mail to <i>corporate.secretary@kraft.com</i>,
by faxing your request to the Corporate Secretary at 847-646-2950,
or by sending a letter to the Corporate Secretary, Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc., Three
Lakes Drive, Northfield, Illinois 60093. Please include the following
information:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Your
name, e-mail and mailing address;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Whether
you need special assistance at the Annual Meeting;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
name of your guest, if any; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>If
your shares are not registered in your name, evidence of your stock ownership
as of February&nbsp;28, 2007 MUST be attached to your e-mail, fax or letter.
You can obtain this evidence from your bank, broker or Computershare Trust Company.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">26.</font></b></font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HOW
DO I GET TO THE ANNUAL MEETING SITE?<a name="a26_HowDoIGetToTheAnnualMeetingSi_184313"></a></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 13.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp; A
map and directions are provided on the back of this Proxy Statement.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">27.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>MAY&nbsp;STOCKHOLDERS
ASK QUESTIONS AT THE ANNUAL MEETING?<a name="a27_MaystockholdersAskQuestionsAt_184313"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Yes.
During the Annual Meeting, stockholders may ask questions or make remarks
directly related to the matters being voted on. In order to ensure an orderly
meeting, we ask that stockholders direct questions and comments to the
Chairman. In order to provide the opportunity to every stockholder who wishes
to speak, each stockholder&#146;s remarks will be limited to two minutes. Stockholders
may speak a second time only after all other stockholders who wish to speak
have had their turn. In addition, the Chairman will answer stockholders&#146;
questions of more general interest at the Stockholder Forum immediately
following the adjournment of the Annual Meeting.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 7.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">28.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>DOES
THE ANNOUNCEMENT THAT ALTRIA GROUP, INC. WILL SPIN-OFF ALL OF IT KRAFT FOODS
INC. SHARES IMPACT THE ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS?</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 13.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">It should not. Unless for
unforeseeable circumstances, the business of the Annual Meeting should be
carried on as usual. As described in Question 7, on the record date Altria
Group owned 276,449,240 of Kraft Foods Inc. Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and
1,180,000,000 shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock. Altria Group is entitled to
vote its shares as of the record date.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">6</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\fc\7120318528_D11189_1851620\7513-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 20:32 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">29.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>ARE MY
VOTES CONFIDENTIAL?<a name="a29_AreMyVotesConfidential_184313"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We will continue our
long-standing practice of holding the votes of each stockholder in confidence
from directors, officers and employees except: (a)&nbsp;as necessary to meet
applicable legal requirements and to assert or defend claims for or against the
Company, (b)&nbsp;in case of a contested proxy solicitation, (c)&nbsp;if a
stockholder makes a written comment on the proxy card or otherwise communicates
his or her vote to management, or (d)&nbsp;to allow the independent inspectors
of election to certify the results of the vote.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">30.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WHO
COUNTS THE VOTES?<a name="a30_WhoCountsTheVotes_184314"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We retain
an independent tabulator to receive and tabulate the proxies and an independent
inspector of election to certify the results. Computershare Trust Company, N.A.
has been appointed Inspector of Election for the Annual Meeting. The Inspector
of Election will determine the number of shares outstanding and voting power of
each, the shares represented at the Annual Meeting, the existence of a quorum,
the validity of proxies and ballots, and will count all votes and ballots.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">31.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HOW
DO I FIND OUT THE ANNUAL MEETING VOTING RESULTS?<a name="a31_HowDoIFindOutTheAnnualMeeting_184314"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Preliminary voting results will be announced at the
Annual Meeting and also via a press release issued immediately after the Annual
Meeting. The final voting results will be published in the Company&#146;s second
quarter 2006 quarterly report on Form&nbsp;10-Q and will also be
available on <i>www.kraft.com</i> (the Company&#146;s
website) by early July&nbsp;or August&nbsp;2007.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">7</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\fc\7120318528_D11189_1851620\7513-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 20:32 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CORPORATE GOVERNANCE<a name="CorporateGovernance_183132"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Board of Directors<a name="BoardOfDirectors_183132"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The primary responsibility of
the Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) is to foster the long-term success of the
Company, consistent with its fiduciary duty to the stockholders. The Board has
the responsibility for establishing broad corporate policies, setting strategic
direction, and overseeing management, which is responsible for the day-to-day
operations of the Company. In fulfilling this role, each director must exercise
his or her good faith business judgment of the best interests of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Governance Principles,
Code of Ethics and Code of Business Conduct<a name="GovernancePrinciplesCodeOfEthicsA_183133"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board has adopted
Corporate Governance Guidelines. The Guidelines are attached as Exhibit&nbsp;A
to this Proxy Statement. In addition, the Company has adopted the Kraft Foods
Code of Conduct for compliance and integrity, a code of ethics as defined in
Item 406 of Regulation&nbsp;S-K. The code applies to all of its employees,
including its principal executive officer, principal financial officer,
principal accounting officer or controller, and persons performing similar
functions. In addition, the Company has adopted a separate Code of Business
Conduct and Ethics that applies to the directors. The Director&#146;s Code is also a
code of ethics as defined in Item&nbsp;406 of Regulation S-K. All of these
materials are available on the Company&#146;s website, www.kraft.com, and will be
provided free of charge to any stockholder requesting a copy by writing to the
Company&#146;s Corporate Secretary, Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc., Three Lakes Drive,
Northfield, Illinois 60093. The information on the Company&#146;s website is not,
and shall not be deemed to be, a part of this Proxy Statement or incorporated
into any other filings the Company makes with the Securities and Exchange
Commission.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Director Independence<a name="DirectorIndependence_183133"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board has determined that each of the following
nominees for director is independent in that such nominee has no material
relationship with the Company: Ajay Banga, Jan Bennink, Mark D. Ketchum,
Richard A. Lerner, M.D., John C. Pope, Mary L. Schapiro, and Deborah C. Wright.
To assist it in making these determinations, the Board has adopted categorical
standards of director independence that are set forth in Annex A to the
Corporate Governance Guidelines. Each of the above-named nominees
qualifies as independent under these categorical standards.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, with respect to Mr.&nbsp;Banga&#146;s
independence, the Board also considered that he is Chairman and CEO, Global Consumer
Group, International of Citigroup Inc., a corporation from which the Company
purchases banking services in the ordinary course of business, and also that
his brother is an executive officer at Unilever, a corporation that pays
royalties to the Company and from which the Company buys ingredients, all in
the ordinary course of business. With respect to Mr.&nbsp;Pope&#146;s independence,
the Board also considered that he serves on the board of directors of&#160; Con-Way,&nbsp;Inc., a corporation from which
the Company purchases transportation services in the ordinary course of
business, and the board of directors of Waste Management,&nbsp;Inc., a
corporation from which the Company purchases waste disposal services in the
ordinary course of business. With respect to Ms.&nbsp;Schapiro&#146;s independence,
the Board considered that she serves on the board of directors of Duke Energy
Corporation, a corporation from which the Company purchases energy in the
ordinary course of business. With respect to Ms.&nbsp;Wright&#146;s independence,
the Board considered that she serves on the board of directors of Time Warner
Inc., a corporation from which the Company purchases media through its
advertising agencies in the ordinary course of business. Because no relevant
transactions occurred, the Board did not consider any such transactions in
making its determination of Messrs. Bennink, Ketchum, and Lerner&#146;s
independence. The Board concluded that Mr.&nbsp;Banga, Mr.&nbsp;Bennink, Mr.&nbsp;Ketchum,
Mr. Lerner, Mr.&nbsp;Pope, Ms.&nbsp;Schapiro, and Ms.&nbsp;Wright are
independent within the meaning of independence under the listing standards of
the NYSE.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There were no other related
party transactions, relationships or arrangements involving the Company&#146;s
independent directors. In addition, there are no family relationships between
any nominees for director, executive officer or person nominated or chosen by
the Company to become a director or executive officer.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\fc\71162134391_H11181_1850493\7513-1-dc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 16:22 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Committees of the Board<a name="CommitteesOfTheBoard_183134"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board
has established three Committees to assist it with the performance of its
responsibilities: the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee and the
Nominating and Governance Committee. The Board designates the members of these
Committees and the Committee chairs annually at its organizational meeting
following the Annual Meeting of Stockholders, based on the recommendation of
the Nominating and Governance Committee. The chair of each Committee, with
input from management and the other members of that Committee, develops the
agenda for that Committee and determines the frequency and length of Committee
meetings. The members of the Committees are identified in the table below:</font></p>

<div align="center">

  <td width="34" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:25.3pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="23" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:17.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
