</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="80" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:59.75pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&#160;&#160; Years of credited service under the plans are equivalent to the
years of total service for the employee through December&nbsp;31, 2006, unless
otherwise noted.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)&#160;&#160; Reflects the actuarial present value of benefits accumulated under
the respective retirement plans, in accordance with the same assumptions
disclosed in Note 15 to the consolidated financial statements contained in the
Company&#146;s Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">47</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='47',FILE='C:\fc\72151816599_D10466_1856976\7513-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 15:19 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The assumptions for the Kraft Foods, Global Inc. Retirement Plan, and
the Kraft Foods Global,&nbsp;Inc. Supplemental Benefits Plans I and II are as
follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;Assumes
commencement at the earliest age that participants would be eligible for an
unreduced pension benefit, which is age 62 for each of the participating named
executive officers. Present value amounts are discounted to current age.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;Valuation date of December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;Discount rate of 5.9%. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;RP 2000 Mortality Table Projected to 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The assumptions for the Kraft
Foods Germany Pension Plan are as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;Assumes
commencement at normal retirement at age 60. The present value amount is
discounted to current age.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;Valuation date of December&nbsp;31, 2006. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;Discount rate of 4.5%. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;Dr.&nbsp;Klaus Heubeck Mortality Table.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 35.0pt;text-indent:-35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
assumptions for the Kraft Foods Switzerland Pension Fund are as follows: </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;Assumes
commencement at normal retirement at age 65. The present value amount is
discounted to current age. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;Valuation date of December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;Discount rate of 3.0%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;BVG 2000 Mortality Table.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Additional detailed information regarding these
pension plans is presented on pages&nbsp;49 and 50.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)&#160;&#160; Reflects the number of years of credited service in connection
with an enhanced pension benefit that provides for additional credited service
during the period Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld was not employed by the Company between
2004 and 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)&#160;&#160; Reflects the number of years of credited service in connection
with a previous agreement that provides for Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi&#146;s Kraft earnings
to be recognized for the purpose of calculating his General Foods pension
benefit and his 11 years of service with General Foods will be recognized for
the purposes of determining early retirement eligibility.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)&#160;&#160; The years of credited service under the Kraft Foods Germany
Pension Plan reflect Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang&#146;s service from his date of hire until
the date he was transferred to Switzerland under a local Switzerland
compensation arrangement. The years of credited service under the Kraft Foods
Switzerland Pension Fund reflect Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang&#146;s service from the date of
his transfer to Switzerland as a local paid employee through December&nbsp;31,
2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6)&#160;&#160; Amount has been converted from Euros to U.S. dollars based on the
December&nbsp;29, 2006 currency translation rate of 1 Euro to $1.3139.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(7)&#160;&#160; Amount has been converted from Swiss Francs to U.S. dollars based on
the December&nbsp;29, 2006 currency translation rate of 1 Swiss Franc to
$0.8173.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">48</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='48',FILE='C:\fc\72151816599_D10466_1856976\7513-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 15:19 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Retirement Benefits</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Both the qualified and
supplemental retirement plans are generally offered to executives, including
the named executive officers, and vary by country.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Kraft Foods Global,&nbsp;Inc.
Retirement Plan</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All eligible full-time and part-time U.S. employees,
including executive officers, are covered automatically in a funded
non-contributory, tax-qualified defined benefit plan offered by the Company. Benefits
under this plan are payable upon retirement in the form of an annuity or a lump
sum (if the employee was hired prior to 2004). Normal retirement under this
plan is defined as age 65 with five years of vesting service, at which point
participants are eligible to receive an unreduced benefit. A participant is
also eligible for an unreduced pension benefit at age 62 with 10 years of
vesting service, provided that the participant was hired prior to January&nbsp;1,
2004. Vested participants may elect to receive benefits prior to age 65, but
the amount is reduced as benefits are paid over a longer period of time. Participants
must have at least five years of service to become vested.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The formula used to
calculate a benefit is equal to the following:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>1.3%
of final average pay up to the Social Security Covered Compensation amount&#160; multiplied by years of service up to 30; plus</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>1.675%
of final average pay in excess of the Social Security Covered Compensation
amount, multiplied by years of service up to 30; plus</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>0.5%
of final average pay multiplied by years of service in excess of 30.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Final average pay is defined as the greater of the
average of an executive&#146;s salary plus annual bonus during the last 60
consecutive months of service before separation or the five highest consecutive
calendar years of salary plus annual bonus out of the last 10 years prior to
separation. Social Security Covered Compensation is an amount equal to the
average of the Social Security taxable wage bases for the 35-year period
that ends in the year the participant reaches age 65. The Internal Revenue Code
has established certain limits on the amount of benefits employees may receive
from this plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, Mr.&nbsp;Dollive
and Mr.&nbsp;Roberts were eligible for early retirement pension benefits under
the Kraft Foods, Global Inc. Retirement Plan and Supplemental Benefits Plan I. Eligibility
for each of the participating named executive officers begins at age 55 with at
least 10 years of vesting service. Early retirement benefits are reduced at a
rate 3% per year for each age that a participant elects to retire prior to age
62 with a maximum reduction of 20% at age 55.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Kraft Foods Global,&nbsp;Inc.
Supplemental Benefits Plan I</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Since there are Internal
Revenue Code established limitations on the amount of benefits employees may
receive from the tax-qualified pension plan, Kraft offers a Supplemental
Defined Benefit Pension Plan. Several named executive officers participate in
the Supplemental Defined Benefit Pension Plan. This is an unfunded plan that
provides for the difference between what would have been payable based upon the
pension plan formula stated above absent the applicable Internal Revenue Code
limits and the amount actually payable from the Kraft Foods Global,&nbsp;Inc.
Retirement Plan.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Kraft Foods Global,&nbsp;Inc.
Supplemental Benefits Plan II - Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The enhanced pension benefit
provided to Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld in connection with her joining the Company
provides for credited service during the period of 2004 to 2006, when she was
not employed by the Company. The formula used to calculate this enhancement is
the same as the formula used under the Kraft Foods Global,&nbsp;Inc. Retirement
Plan without regard to Internal Revenue Code limitations. The value of this
enhancement at current compensation levels, based on current assumptions, is
approximately $670,833.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">49</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='49',FILE='C:\fc\7215595194_D10466_1857254\7513-1-ec.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 16:00 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Kraft Foods Global,&nbsp;Inc.
Supplemental Benefits Plan II - Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consistent with a previous
agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi&#146;s Kraft earnings will be recognized for the
purpose of calculating his General Foods pension benefit and his 11 years of
service with General Foods will be recognized for the purposes of determining
early retirement eligibility under the Kraft Foods Global,&nbsp;Inc.
Supplemental Benefits Plan II. The value of this enhancement is $3,805,889.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Kraft Foods Germany Pension Plan</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All eligible full-time employees in Germany, including
executive officers, are covered automatically in a funded non-contributory,
German tax-qualified defined benefit plan offered by the Company. Benefits
under this plan are payable upon retirement in the form of an annuity.
Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang is grandfathered under the plan and is eligible for normal
retirement at age 60. Since this is a frozen pension plan for all participants,
all benefits under the plan are vested.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This is a frozen pension plan and the benefit is based
on Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang&#146;s 1998 base salary and years of service, up to age 60.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The formula used to
calculate a benefit is equal to the following:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Years
to retirement multiplied by 0.4% multiplied by Social Security Cap Limit (50,311
Euros, or $66,104 based on the December&nbsp;29, 2007 currency translation rate
of 1 Euro to $1.3139); plus</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Years to retirement
multiplied by 1.5% multiplied by 12 months multiplied by the Salary above the
Social Security Cap Limit (50,311 Euros or $66,104).</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Kraft Foods Switzerland Pension Fund
Summary&#160; </font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The calculation for the normal retirement pension is
based on current base salary and years of service calculated up to age 65. Participants
may elect to receive benefits as early as age 57, but the amount is reduced as
benefits are paid over a longer period of time. Employee and employer
contributions are 8%. In addition the employer pays for any additional
contributions required over the mandatory 8%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The formula used to
calculate a benefit is equal to the following:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>1.85% multiplied by years
of service (maximum of 37 years) multiplied by the participant&#146;s salary. The maximum
salary limit in 2006 was 774,000 Swiss Francs or $632,590, based on the December&nbsp;29,
2006 currency translation rate of 1 Swiss Franc to $0.8173.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">50</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='50',FILE='C:\fc\7215595194_D10466_1857254\7513-1-ec.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 16:00 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="80" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:59.75pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&#160;&#160; All executive and registrant contributions made in 2006 were under
the Company&#146;s U.S. Supplemental Defined Contribution Plan. Amounts are deferred
from the base salary and the Management Incentive Plan amount paid in 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)&#160;&#160; The aggregate Earnings and balance include amounts previously
deferred under the Altria Deferred Long-Term Incentive Plan and the General
Foods Management Performance Awards Plan. The aggregate earnings and balance
under the Altria Deferred Long-Term Incentive Plan are $37,445 and $585,691,
respectively. The aggregate earnings and balance under the General Foods
Management Performance Awards Plan are $15,455 and $347,385, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)&#160;&#160; The aggregate earnings and balance include amounts previously
deferred under the Altria Deferred Long-Term Incentive Plan. The aggregate earnings
and balance are $103,751 and $1,444,024, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)&#160;&#160; The amounts include earnings and an account balance under the
Germany Bonus Deferral plan. The return is fixed at 6%, which was the market
rate at the time of deferral.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)&#160;&#160; Amount has been converted from Euros to U.S. dollars based on the
December&nbsp;29, 2006 currency translation rate of 1 Euro to $1.3139.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">U.S. Supplemental Defined
Contribution Plan </font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Since there are Internal Revenue Code established
limitations on the amount that may be contributed to the tax-qualified defined
contribution plan on behalf of an employee, Kraft offers a Supplemental Defined
Contribution Plan. All of the named executive officers, with the exception of Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang,
participate in the Supplemental Defined Contribution Plan. This is an unfunded
plan that allows eligible employees to defer a portion of their annual
compensation (base salary and annual incentive awards) and receive
corresponding company matching </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">51</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='51',FILE='C:\fc\7215595194_D10466_1857254\7513-1-ec.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 16:00 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">amounts to the extent that their contributions to the
tax-qualified defined contribution plan (and the corresponding company matching
contributions) are limited by Internal Revenue Code section 401(a)(17) or 415. Executives
must defer receipt of the payments until retirement. Executive contributions
and employer matching amounts earn the same rate of return as the Interest
Income Fund, which is a market rate fund available to employees in the
tax-qualified defined contribution plan. The rate of return under this
investment fund in 2006 was 4.52%.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Altria Deferred Long-Term Incentive
Plan</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This plan provided participants in the Altria
Long-Term Incentive Plan the opportunity to defer receipt of the Cash-Based
Long-Term Incentive award at the end of each performance cycle. These deferred
amounts were and continue to be credited with a fixed rate of return set at the
time of deferral. Mr.&nbsp;Dollive deferred receipt of his 1995&#151;1997 award
which is credited at an annual rate of 6.83%. Mr.&nbsp;Roberts deferred receipt
of his 1990&#151;1992 award which is credited at an annual rate of 9.00%. Mr.&nbsp;Roberts
also deferred receipt of his 1995&#151;1997 Long-Term Incentive award which is
credited at an annual rate of 6.83%. Both Messrs.&nbsp;Dollive and Roberts
deferred receipt of their awards until retirement, at which time they will
receive their awards plus accumulated interest as a lump sum. The opportunity
for executives to defer under this program was discontinued after the 1995&#151;1997
performance cycle. Therefore, the plan has not permitted future deferrals since
1998.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">General Foods Management Performance
Awards Plan</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This plan was available to General Foods executives
which allowed for the deferrals of annual performance awards. Deferred amounts
are credited with a composite rate which is equal to the average of the
interest yield established each year under the U.S. tax-qualified defined
contribution plan Interest Income Fund and the rate of prime 90-day
commercial paper issued by industrial corporations. In 2006, the rate of return
credited to deferred balances was equal to 4.66%. Mr.&nbsp;Dollive elected to
defer receipt of his award until retirement. Mr.&nbsp;Dollive can elect to
receive his award and accumulated interest as a lump sum payment or receive
annual installment payments for a period of up to 15 years. The opportunity for
executives to defer under this program was discontinued and the last year in
which deferrals were permitted was 1995.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Germany Bonus Deferral Plan </font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employees in Germany can defer up to 100% of one year&#146;s
bonus and Kraft will match 10% of that year&#146;s annual incentive. The amount
earns interest of 6% according to an actuarial longevity calculation in a
separate account for the employee. Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang elected to defer 62,633
euros, or $82,293, based on the December&nbsp;29, 2006 currency translation
rate of 1 euro to $1.3139. This amount reflects 25% of his 1996 annual
incentive. Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang can elect to receive his award and accumulated
interest as a lump sum payment at age 60 or receive annual installment payments
for a period of up to 10 years.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">52</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='52',FILE='C:\fc\7215595194_D10466_1857254\7513-1-ec.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 16:00 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Potential Payments Upon
Termination or Change-in-Control<a name="PotentialPaymentsUponTerminationO_221420"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Involuntary Termination without
Cause</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company generally provides separation pay and
benefits to its executives, including the named executive officers, in the
event of an involuntary termination without cause. These separation benefits
are generally structured similarly to those pay and benefits available to all
other employees and take account of the employee&#146;s years of service with the
Company. The separation pay and benefits available to all employees are
generally contingent upon the Company receiving a general release of claims
from the employee. For executives, it is typical to use the separation pay and
benefits practices in the applicable country as the basis for severance.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On a case-by-case basis, the Company may provide
additional pay and benefits to named executive officers in excess of the amount
typically payable under a severance pay plan. These additional pay and benefits
amounts would be compensation for receiving non-competition, non-solicitation,
non-disparagement and confidentiality agreements with executives, in addition
to the general release.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The typical elements of
separation pay and benefits consist of base salary continuation, health and
welfare benefits continuation, and outplacement assistance.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Severance Pay</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Severance pay to named executive officers is typically
12 months of base salary and typically include pro-rated incentive payments
under the Company&#146;s annual incentive and long-term incentive cash programs. That
amount may be increased, at the discretion of management, with the approval of
the Committee, in exchange for the executive&#146;s acceptance of the restrictive
covenants described above. Severance pay amounts are typically paid as salary
continuation. In some cases amounts are payable in the form of a lump sum.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event that separation pay is considered
deferred compensation and, subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue
Code, payments that would otherwise have been immediately payable are withheld
during the six month period following termination of employment. The Company
then pays the amount accrued over the six months, in a lump sum without
interest, as soon as permitted under Section&nbsp;409A.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition to the severance
pay and benefits described above, in accordance with Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s
letter of employment, if she is involuntarily terminated without cause prior to
the vesting of the restricted stock award she was granted upon her joining the
Company, she will continue to vest in the restricted stock award on the
scheduled vesting dates.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Health and Welfare
Benefits Continuation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Named executive
officers typically continue participating in the health and welfare benefits
during the salary continuation period. If an executive receives severance pay
in a lump sum, they are not eligible to participate in the health and welfare
benefits plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, Mr. Deromedi is
eligible to receive lifetime medical, dental and life insurance per an
agreement dated March 27, 1989. Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi began receiving such benefits
following his salary continuation period which ended on February&nbsp;23, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Separation Agreements
for Named Executive Officers<a name="SeparationAgreementsForNamedExecu_221422"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company entered into
separation agreements in 2006 with Messrs.&nbsp;Deromedi and Johnson. Details
of these agreements are below.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">53</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='53',FILE='C:\fc\72133528464_D11265_1856355\7513-1-ee.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 13:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Provisions of Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi&#146;s
Separation Agreement<a name="ProvisionsOfMr_deromedisSeparatio_221423"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&#160; Deromedi ended his employment with Kraft Foods Inc. on June&nbsp;26,
2006. The following are the terms of his separation agreement:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi
received salary continuation at his rate of pay in the effect on his
termination date ($1,200,000) until February&nbsp;23, 2007. During that period
he continued to participate in Kraft&#146;s medical, dental, life insurance,
long-term disability, personal accident insurance, tax-qualified and
supplemental defined contribution plans and retirement plans as if he were an
active employee (subject to tax rules&nbsp;that prohibit severance payment
recognition under the tax-qualified defined contribution plan after December&nbsp;31,
2006).</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Following
the end of the salary continuation period, Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi received a lump
sum payment equal to the salary that he would have received from February&nbsp;24,
2007 through June&nbsp;26, 2008.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Following
the salary continuation period, under an agreement related to the acquisition
of Kraft Foods Inc. by Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. and dated March&nbsp;27, 1989, Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi
will be covered by lifetime medical, dental and life insurance benefits on
terms at least as favorable as those that were available to the other Kraft
Foods Inc. executives as of December&nbsp;1, 1988. In addition, consistent with
a previous agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi&#146;s Kraft earnings will be recognized for
the purpose of calculating his General Foods pension benefit and his 11 years
of service with General Foods will be recognized for the purposes of
determining early retirement eligibility under the Kraft Foods Global,&nbsp;Inc.
Supplemental Benefits Plan II.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi
received a payment of $855,000 for his 2006 Annual Incentive award, pro-rated
for service through June&nbsp;30, 2006 and based on Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi&#146;s
individual target percentage of 150% and the actual business unit rating for
Kraft for 2006. This payment was made on December&nbsp;29, 2006.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi
received a payment of $5,075,000 for his 2004-2006 Long-Term Incentive
Plan (LTIP) award, pro-rated for service from January&nbsp;1, 2004 through June&nbsp;30,
2006 and based on Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi&#146;s individual target percentage of 250%, the
actual Kraft LTIP rating and Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi&#146;s base salaries in effect on December&nbsp;31,
2004, December&nbsp;31, 2005 and June&nbsp;30, 2006. This payment was made
concurrently with LTIP payments to other eligible Kraft LTIP recipients.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi
realized income of $4,797,152 on 141,697 shares of restricted stock that became
vested on August&nbsp;31, 2006 in accordance with his separation agreement. All
other restricted stock shares were forfeited.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi
is entitled to retain his outstanding vested stock options of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc.
and Kraft Foods Inc. until their expiration date.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi
is entitled to continue to participate in the executive car policy and security
program through the salary continuation period.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi
is entitled to outplacement services and professional fee reimbursement, up to
a combined maximum of $100,000.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
consideration for the payments detailed above, Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi agreed
pursuant to the Separation Agreement to the following conditions:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>not to work for
specified competitors of Kraft through October&nbsp;31, 2007,</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>not to solicit Kraft&#146;s
employees through October&nbsp;31, 2007,</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iii)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>to certain
confidentiality and non-disparagement obligations and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iv)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>subject to specified
conditions, to cooperate with Kraft with respect to the defense of any matter
in which he was involved during his employment with Kraft.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">54</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Provisions of Mr.&nbsp;Johnson&#146;s
Separation Agreement<a name="ProvisionsOfMr_johnsonsSeparation_221425"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company announced
the departure of Mr.&nbsp;Johnson on September&nbsp;12, 2006. The following are
the terms of his separation agreement:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Johnson
was paid his regular salary through October&nbsp;31, 2006 (the &#147;Termination
Date&#148;).</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 31.8pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-11.8pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>After
May&nbsp;1, 2007, Mr.&nbsp;Johnson will receive the following separation
payments from Kraft:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>by May&nbsp;10,
2007, a lump sum payment, less applicable withholding, equal to six (6)&nbsp;months
of Mr.&nbsp;Johnson&#146;s base salary in effect on the Termination Date; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>twelve (12) months of
his salary to be paid on a salary continuation basis, at his bi-weekly base
salary in effect on the Termination Date, from May&nbsp;1, 2007 through April&nbsp;30,
2008 (the &#147;Salary Continuation Period&#148;).</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Johnson also
received:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a payment of
$391,400 in respect of his 2006 annual incentive award under the Kraft
Management Incentive Plan, paid on the basis of Mr.&nbsp;Johnson&#146;s individual
target percentage and the actual business unit rating for Kraft for full fiscal
year 2006 as determined by the Compensation Committee of Kraft&#146;s Board of
Directors (the &#147;Committee&#148;), pro-rated from January&nbsp;1, 2006 through the October&nbsp;31,
2006,</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a payment of $1,543,400
in respect of his 2004-2006 Long-Term Incentive Plan (&#147;LTIP&#148;) award, to
be paid on the basis of Mr.&nbsp;Johnson&#146;s individual target percentage and the
actual Kraft LTIP rating, as determined by the Committee, pro-rated from January&nbsp;1,
2004 through the Termination Date, and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iii)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a lump sum payment, less
required deductions, of $1,877,000.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Johnson
is entitled to exercise any vested stock options that he holds in Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc.
and the Company pursuant to the terms of the applicable option grant up until
12 months from his Termination Date.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Johnson
forfeits any right to his unvested 2004, 2005 and 2006 Kraft restricted stock
awards.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Johnson
is eligible to receive Kraft medical, dental, life, long-term disability and
personal accident insurance coverage pursuant to the terms of these Kraft
benefit plans as if he were an employee until April&nbsp;30, 2008 subject to
agreeing to reimburse Kraft for the costs of such medical and dental insurance
coverage.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Johnson
will also be credited with pension service under Kraft&#146;s Defined Benefit
Pension Plan (both funded and supplemental) from November&nbsp;1, 2006 through April&nbsp;30,
2008.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
consideration for the payments detailed above, Mr.&nbsp;Johnson agreed pursuant
to the Separation Agreement to the following conditions:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>not to work for
specified competitors of Kraft through October&nbsp;31, 2007,</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>not to solicit Kraft&#146;s
employees through October&nbsp;31, 2007,</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iii)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>to certain
confidentiality and non-disparagement obligations and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iv)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>subject
to specified conditions, to cooperate with Kraft with respect to the defense of
any matter in which he was involved during his employment with Kraft.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">55</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='55',FILE='C:\fc\72133528464_D11265_1856355\7513-1-ee.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 13:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Potential Payout Upon
an Involuntary Termination Without Cause</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The table below was prepared as though each of the
named executive officers had Involuntarily Terminated Without Cause on December&nbsp;29,
2006 (or on the actual separation dates for Messrs.&nbsp;Deromedi and Johnson).
The assumptions and valuations are noted in the footnotes to the table.</font></p>

<p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Involuntary
Termination Without Cause</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="80" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:59.75pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&#160;&#160; For the named executive officers active as of December&nbsp;31,
2006, the amounts reflect the following:&#160;&#160;
24 months of base salary continuation for Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld; and 12
months of base salary continuation for each of the other named executive
officers. For Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi, the amount reflects 24 months of base salary
payments, per his separation agreement. For Mr.&nbsp;Johnson, the amount
reflects 18 months of base salary payments, per his separation agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)&#160;&#160; Amounts reflect the pro-rated annual cash and long-term incentive
plan awards based on business performance ratings of 100% and awards paid at
the named executive officer&#146;s individual target, unless otherwise noted.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)&#160;&#160; Amounts reflect the Company cost of providing health and welfare
benefits for the period of time the named executive officer continues on base
salary continuation, unless otherwise noted.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)&#160;&#160; Per the terms of Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s employment offer, all
unvested restricted shares granted to her as a sign-on award will continue to
vest on the scheduled vesting dates. The value of the restricted stock award is
based on a December&nbsp;29, 2006 closing stock price of $35.70.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)&#160;&#160; Amounts reflect the pro-rated annual cash and long-term incentive
plan awards consistent with the terms of Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi&#146;s separation
agreement. Both the annual cash and long-term incentive awards were prorated
through June&nbsp;30, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6)&#160;&#160; Amount includes six months of health and welfare benefits ($4,000)
while Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi was on salary continuation. The additional $534,000
reflects the present value of the retiree medical, dental and life insurance
Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi will receive for his lifetime under a previous agreement with
the Company.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">56</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='56',FILE='C:\fc\72133528464_D11265_1856355\7513-1-ee.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 13:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(7)&#160;&#160; Reflects the partial vesting of restricted stock grants awarded to
him in 2004 and 2005 that vested on August&nbsp;31, 2006. The amount is equal
to the fair market value of the awards on August&nbsp;31, 2006 which was the
date of the executed agreement. The fair market value on August&nbsp;31, 2006
was $33.86.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(8)&#160;&#160; The value reflects the maximum amount reimbursable for
professional and outplacement fees, however, this value excludes
Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi&#146;s continued participation in the Company&#146;s executive car and
security program through February&nbsp;23, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(9)&#160;&#160; The amount reflects the additional estimated present value of
Mr.&nbsp;Deromedi&#146;s benefit accrued during the period from January&nbsp;1, 2007
through February&nbsp;23, 2007. The assumptions for this calculation are
consistent with the assumptions disclosed in the Pension Benefits table on
page&nbsp;47. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(10) Amounts reflect the pro-rated annual cash and long-term incentive
plan awards consistent with the terms of Mr.&nbsp;Johnson&#146;s separation
agreement. Both the annual cash and long-term incentive awards were prorated
through October&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(11) Amount reflects a discretionary separation payment. Additional
provisions of Mr.&nbsp;Johnson&#146;s agreement are presented on page&nbsp;55.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(12) The amount reflects the additional estimated present value of
Mr.&nbsp;Johnson&#146;s benefit accrued during the 18-month salary
continuation period. The assumptions for this calculation are consistent with
the assumptions disclosed in the Pension Benefits table on page&nbsp;47.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(13)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Based
on the December&nbsp;29, 2006 currency translation rate of 1 Swiss Franc to
$0.8173.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Change-in-Control Arrangements</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company does not currently
maintain a change-in-control severance plan. In the event of a
change-in-control, unvested stock awards would immediately vest and be payable
in cash immediately following the consummation of a change-in-control at the &#147;Change-in-Control
Price&#148;, as defined in the 2005 Performance Incentive Plan. In addition, any
pro-rated incentive awards earned under an incentive plan covered under the
2005 Performance Incentive Plan shall be immediately payable in cash at the
participant&#146;s maximum award opportunity multiplied by the number of full and
partial months that had elapsed during the performance cycle. In general, any
excise tax payments are the responsibility of the executive. Although, in
accordance with Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s letter of employment, the Company agreed
to reimburse and fully gross up for any excise or additional taxes that are
incurred from the vesting of the restricted stock award granted in connection
with her joining the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Potential Payout Upon
an Involuntary Termination Due to a Change-in-Control</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The table below was prepared
as though each of the named executive officers had been terminated
involuntarily without cause following a change-in-control on December&nbsp;29,
2006. The assumptions and valuations are noted in the footnotes to the table.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">57</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.05pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.45pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="80" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:59.75pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&#160;&#160; The amounts reflect 24 months of base salary
continuation for Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld and 12 months of base salary continuation
for each of the other named executive officers. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)&#160;&#160; Values reflect the estimated maximum award
amount based on target business unit ratings (100%) and the named executive
officer&#146;s individual award maximum (approximately 200% of target). The maximum
amount is capped at $10 million, under the 2005 Performance Incentive Plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)&#160;&#160; Values reflect the estimated maximum award
amount based on a target Company rating (100%) and the named executive
officer&#146;s individual award maximum (110% of target). The maximum amount is
capped at $8 million per each year of the performance cycle, under the 2005 Performance
Incentive Plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)&#160;&#160; Amount reflects the Company cost of providing
health and welfare benefits for the period of time the named executive officer
continues on base salary continuation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)&#160;&#160; The values reflect the immediate vesting of
all outstanding restricted stock awards as of the effective date of the change-in-control,
based on a December&nbsp;29, 2006 closing stock price of $35.70.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6)&#160;&#160; The assumptions used to
calculate the excise and associated taxes for Ms. Rosenfeld are as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#150;&#160; change in control occurs on December&nbsp;29, 2006 and Ms.
Rosenfeld is terminated on that date;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#150;&#160; Ms. Rosenfeld&#146;s restricted stock award granted on June&nbsp;27,
2006 vests December&nbsp;29, 2006;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#150;&#160; base amount for calculations are based on taxable wages for the
years 2001 through 2003; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#150;&#160; Ms. Rosenfeld was assumed to be subject to the maximum Federal and
Illinois income and other payroll taxes, aggregating to an effective tax rate
of 39.45%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 1.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(7)&#160;&#160; Based on the December&nbsp;29, 2006 currency
translation rate of 1 Swiss Franc to $0.8173.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.5pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Potential Payout Upon Other Types of Separations</font></u></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event that a named
executive officer is terminated from the Company due to death, disability or
normal retirement, all unvested restricted stock would vest in all cases. In
addition, such named executive officers would become eligible for award
payments under the annual cash and long-term incentive plans. Such award
payments would be pro-rated based on the number of months such named executive
officer participated in the applicable plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other than the types of
compensation and benefits described in the above tables or as would be received
by all other salaried employees, no other special payments are earned by or
would be awarded to the named executive officers.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">58</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='58',FILE='C:\fc\72133528464_D11265_1856355\7513-1-ee.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 13:37 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">OWNERSHIP OF EQUITY
SECURITIES<a name="OwnershipOfEquitySecurities_001510"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table shows the number of shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and
Altria Group common stock beneficially owned at February&nbsp;9, 2007, by each
director, nominee for director, executive officer named in the Summary Compensation
Table, and the directors and executive officers of the Company as a group. None
of these individuals owns Class&nbsp;B Common Stock. None of the Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock owned by these individuals are subject to any pledge. Unless
otherwise indicated, each of the named individuals has sole voting and
investment power with respect to the shares shown. The beneficial ownership of
the directors and executive officers of the Company individually and as a group
is less than 1% of the outstanding Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and less than 1%
of Altria Group&#146;s outstanding common stock.</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&#160;&#160; Includes maximum number of shares as to which these individuals
can acquire beneficial ownership upon the exercise of stock options that are
currently vested or that will vest before April&nbsp;9, 2007 as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Dollive,
96,774; Mr.&nbsp;Pope, 3,995; Ms.&nbsp;Schapiro, 3995; Mr.&nbsp;Searer,
103,240; Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang, 80,570; Mr.&nbsp;Wall, 26,620; Ms.&nbsp;Wright,
3,995; and group, 436,119. Also includes shares of restricted stock awarded
under the 2001 and 2005 Performance Incentive Plans as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Dollive,
57,530; Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld, 531,510; Mr.&nbsp;Searer, 124,000; Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang,
93,370; and group, 1,182,834. Also includes shares of restricted and deferred
stock pursuant to the 2001 Non-Employee Directors Plan and 2006 Stock
Compensation Plan for Non-Employee Directors as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Bennink,
3,689; Dr.&nbsp;Lerner, 3,689; Mr.&nbsp;Pope, 3,689; Ms.&nbsp;Schapiro, 3,689; Ms.&nbsp;Wright,
3,689; and group, 18,445. Includes 300 shares as to which Mr.&nbsp;Pope
disclaims beneficial ownership (shares held by children) and 100 shares as to
which Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld disclaims beneficial ownership (shares held by
spouse). Does not include share equivalents held pursuant to the 2001
Non-Employee Directors Plan as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Pope, 7,238; and Ms.&nbsp;Schapiro,
5,680.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)&#160;&#160; Includes
maximum number of shares as to which these individuals can acquire beneficial
ownership upon the exercise of stock options that are currently vested or that
will vest before April&nbsp;9, 2007 as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Camilleri, 1,960,140, Mr.&nbsp;Dollive,
123,942; Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang, 108,800; Mr.&nbsp;Wall, 1,097,039; and group,
3,502,153. Also includes shares of restricted common stock as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Camilleri,
496,900; Mr.&nbsp;Devitre, 56,000; Mr.&nbsp;Wall, 130,950; and group, 683,850.
Includes 14,000 shares as to which Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang disclaims beneficial
ownership (shares held by spouse). Does not include share equivalents held
pursuant to the 2005 Performance Incentive Plan as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Camilleri,
114,470; Mr.&nbsp;Devitre, 24,040; and Mr.&nbsp;Wall, 25,190. Also does not
include share equivalents held pursuant to the Company&#146;s 2006 Stock
Compensation Plan for Non-Employee Directors as follows: Dr.&nbsp;Lerner,
2,478.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">59</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='59',FILE='C:\fc\72112417332_D11265_1855575\7513-1-eg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 11:25 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At February&nbsp;9,
2007, Altria Group beneficially owned 276,456,140 shares of Class&nbsp;A Common
Stock, representing 60.1% of the outstanding Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, and
1,180,000,000 shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock, representing 100% of the
outstanding Class&nbsp;B Common Stock. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other than
Altria Group, the only persons or groups known to the Company to be beneficial
owners of more than 5% of its Common Stock were as follows:</font></p>
