<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="80" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:59.75pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&#160;&#160; The Company has obtained information
concerning the Class&nbsp;A Common Stock beneficially owned by Lord, Abbett&nbsp;&amp;
Co.&nbsp;LLC as of December&nbsp;29, 2006 from a Schedule&nbsp;13G dated February&nbsp;12,
2007, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission by Lord, Abbett&nbsp;&amp;
Co. LLC.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">60</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='60',FILE='C:\fc\72112417332_D11265_1855575\7513-1-eg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 11:25 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS
AND RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS<a name="CertainRelationshipsAndRelatedPar_232607"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Relationship with
Altria Group<a name="RelationshipWithAltriaGroup_232607"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At February&nbsp;28, 2007, Altria Group owned 88.8% of
the outstanding shares of the Company&#146;s capital stock through its ownership of 60.1%
of the outstanding Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, and 100% of the outstanding Class&nbsp;B
Common Stock. Class&nbsp;A Common Stock has one vote per share while Class&nbsp;B
Common Stock has ten votes per share. Therefore, at February&nbsp;28, 2007,
Altria Group held 98.5% of the combined voting power of the outstanding Common
Stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On January&nbsp;31, 2007, Altria Group&#146;s Board of
Directors approved a tax-free distribution to its stockholders of all of its
interest in the Company (the &#147;Distribution&#148;). Until the Distribution, Altria
Group will continue to own shares representing more than 50% of the combined
voting power of the Common Stock, being able to direct the election of all
members of the Board and exercise a controlling influence over the business and
affairs of the Company. In connection with the Distribution, Mr.&nbsp;Wall and Mr.&nbsp;Devitre
will either resign on the Distribution date or not stand for re-election at the
Company&#146;s 2007 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, whichever is earlier. The Board
requested that and Mr.&nbsp;Camilleri agreed to continue serving on the Company&#146;s
Board after the Distribution and to be renominated for election at the 2007
Annual Meeting. On the Distribution date, Mr.&nbsp;Camilleri will resign the
Chairmanship.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included below are
descriptions of certain agreements, relationships and transactions the Company
has with Altria Group that will remain in effect until the Distribution. The
agreements are filed as exhibits to the Company&#146;s filings with the Securities
and Exchange Commission and the summaries below are qualified in all respects
by reference to the full text of the exhibits.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;">Corporate Agreement<a name="CorporateAgreement_232607"></a></font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has entered into a corporate agreement
with Altria Group under which Altria Group has a continuing option to purchase
additional shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock. Altria Group may exercise the
option simultaneously with the issuance of any equity security of the Company,
only to the extent necessary to permit Altria Group to maintain its
then-existing percentage ownership of Common Stock. This option is not
exercisable upon the issuance of stock in connection with employee
compensation. The purchase price of the shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
purchased upon any exercise of this option will be equal to the price paid for Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock in the related issuance if the Company issues Class&nbsp;A Common
Stock for cash, or the then current market price of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
if the Company issues a different equity security or Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
for other than cash.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The corporate agreement provides that all material
intercompany transactions, including any material amendments to the corporate
agreement, the services agreement, the tax sharing agreement or any other
agreement between the Company and Altria Group, will be subject to the approval
of the Audit Committee of the Board, which is composed solely of independent
directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has agreed with Altria Group that both it
and Altria Group have the right to engage in the same or similar business
activities as the other party, do business with any customer or client of the
other party, and employ or engage any officer or employee of the other party.
Neither Altria Group nor the Company, nor their respective related persons,
will be liable to the other as a result of engaging in any of these activities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the corporate agreement, the Company must obtain
Altria Group&#146;s written consent before: entering into any agreement binding
Altria Group or that contains provisions that trigger a default or require a
material payment when Altria Group exercises its rights to convert Class&nbsp;B
Common Stock; declaring extraordinary dividends; and issuing any equity
securities except for Class&nbsp;A Common Stock issued or granted to the
Company&#146;s employees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The corporate agreement will
terminate on the date of the Distribution, except that the indemnification provisions
will survive the termination.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">61</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='61',FILE='C:\fc\71233329342_D11189_1852482\7513-1-ei.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 23:34 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;">Services Agreement<a name="ServicesAgreement_232608"></a></font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Altria Group&#146;s subsidiary, Altria Corporate Services,&nbsp;Inc.,
provides the Company with various services, including planning, legal,
treasury, auditing, insurance, human resources, office of the secretary,
corporate affairs, information technology, aviation and tax services. Billings
for these services, which were based on the cost to Altria Corporate Services,&nbsp;Inc.
to provide such services and a 5% management fee based on wages and benefits,
were $178 million, $237 million and $310 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively. These costs were paid to Altria Corporate
Services,&nbsp;Inc. monthly. The Company performed at a similar cost various
functions in 2006 and 2005 that previously had been provided by Altria
Corporate Services,&nbsp;Inc., resulting in lower service charges in 2006 and
2005. The Company plans to undertake all remaining services currently provided
by Altria Corporate Services,&nbsp;Inc. at a similar cost in 2007. Although the
cost of these services cannot be quantified on a stand-alone basis, management
has assessed that the billings are reasonable based on the level of support
provided by Altria Corporate Services,&nbsp;Inc., and that they reflect all
services provided. The cost and nature of the services are reviewed annually by
the Company&#146;s Audit Committee, which is comprised of independent directors. The
effects of these transactions are included in operating cash flows in the
Company&#146;s consolidated statements of cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Altria Corporate Services,&nbsp;Inc.
and the Company may each terminate any or all of the services under the
services agreement by giving the other party written notice at least
12&nbsp;months in advance of termination. The Company anticipates that the
services agreement will terminate on the date of the Distribution, and Altria
Corporate Services,&nbsp;Inc. has agreed to provide the Company with reasonable
assistance to make an orderly transition to other service providers upon the
termination of the services agreement.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;">Tax-Sharing Agreement<a name="TaxsharingAgreement_232608"></a></font></i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The U.S. accounts of the
Company are included in the consolidated federal income tax return of Altria
Group. Income taxes are generally computed on a separate company basis. To the
extent that foreign tax credits, capital losses and other credits generated by
the Company, which cannot currently be utilized on a separate company basis,
are utilized in Altria Group&#146;s consolidated federal income tax return, the
benefit is recognized in the calculation of the Company&#146;s provision for income
taxes. Based on the Company&#146;s current estimate, this benefit is calculated to
be approximately $195 million, $225 million and $70 million for the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively. The amounts in 2005 and
2006 include dividend repatriations and the impact of certain legal entity
reorganizations. The benefit is dependent on a variety of tax attributes that
have a tendency to vary year to year.</font> The Company makes payments to, or is reimbursed by, Altria Group
for the tax effects resulting from its inclusion in Altria Group&#146;s consolidated
federal income tax return, including current taxes payable and net changes in
tax provisions. The Company is assessing opportunities to mitigate the loss of
tax benefits upon Altria Group&#146;s distribution of its Kraft shares, and
currently estimates the annual amount of lost tax benefits to be in the range
of $50 million to $75 million. Significant judgment is required in determining
income tax provisions and in evaluating tax positions. The Company establishes
additional provisions for income taxes when, despite the belief that existing
tax positions are fully supportable, there remain certain positions that are
likely to be challenged and that may not be sustained on review by tax
authorities. The Company evaluates and potentially adjusts these provisions in
light of changing facts and circumstances. The consolidated tax provision
includes the impact of changes to accruals that are deemed necessary. The
Company expects its effective tax rate to average 35.5% in 2007 (up from 31.7%
in 2006), excluding the impact of charges for asset impairment, exit and
implementation costs, and one-time gains and losses related to acquisitions and
divestitures.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;">Borrowings from Altria Group<a name="BorrowingsFromAltriaGroup_232609"></a></font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005,
the Company had short-term amounts payable to Altria Group of $607 million and
$652 million, respectively. The amounts payable to Altria Group generally
include accrued dividends, taxes and service fees. Interest on intercompany
borrowings is based on the applicable London Interbank Offered Rate.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">62</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='62',FILE='C:\fc\71233329342_D11189_1852482\7513-1-ei.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 23:34 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Review, Approval and
Ratification of Transactions with Related Persons<a name="ReviewApprovalAndRatificationOfTr_232609"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board has adopted written
policy and procedures for review, approval and ratification of transactions
involving the Company and &#147;related persons&#148;. Related persons include the
Company&#146;s executive officers, directors, 5% or more beneficial owners of our
common stock, immediate family members of these persons and entities in which
one of these persons has a direct or indirect material interest. The policy
covers any related person transaction that meets the minimum threshold for
disclosure in the proxy statement under the relevant SEC rules&nbsp;(generally,
transactions involving amounts exceeding $120,000 in which a related person has
a direct or indirect material interest).</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Policy</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Related
person transactions must be approved by the Board&#146;s Nominating and Governance
Committee or any other committee of the Board comprised of independent
directors designated by the Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>When
determining whether to approve, ratify, disapprove or reject any transaction,
the relevant committee will consider all relevant factors, including the
commercial reasonableness of the transaction, the materiality of the related
person&#146;s direct or indirect interest in the transaction, whether the
transaction may involve an actual or the appearance of a conflict of interest,
and the impact of the transaction on
director&#146;s independence as defined in the Company&#146;s Corporate Governance
Guidelines and under NYSE listing standards.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The relevant committee will
approve or ratify only those related person transactions that it determines in
good faith are in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders.</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Procedures</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Each
director, director nominee and executive officer must promptly notify the
Corporate Secretary in writing of any direct or indirect interest that such
person or an immediate family member of such person had, has or may have in a
transaction in which the Company participates.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Any
reported transaction that may qualify as a related person transaction will be
referred to the Board&#146;s Nominating and Governance Committee or any other
committee of the Board comprised of independent directors designated by the
Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>If
the related person participating in the reported transaction is a director or
an immediate family member of a director, then the director cannot participate
in any deliberations or decisions regarding the reported transaction.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>If
the relevant committee determines that the reported transaction is a related
person transaction, then such committee will review, approve, disapprove or
ratify the related person transaction.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>If
the related person transaction was not approved in advance or if a reported
transaction was not determined to be a related person transaction at the time
it was entered into but thereafter became a related person transaction, such
transaction must be presented to the relevant committee for ratification. If
such related person transaction is not ratified by the relevant committee, then
the Company will take all reasonable actions to attempt to terminate the
Company&#146;s participation in such transaction.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The Company may perform an annual search of its
accounts payable, accounts receivable and other databases to identify any other
potential related person transactions that may require disclosure.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the Company&#146;s
policy and procedures, no reported transaction qualified as a related person
transaction and therefore no reported transaction was referred to the Board&#146;s
Nominating and Governance Committee for review.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">63</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='63',FILE='C:\fc\71233329342_D11189_1852482\7513-1-ei.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 23:34 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SECTION&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;BENEFICIAL
OWNERSHIP REPORTING COMPLIANCE<a name="Section16abeneficialOwnershipRepo_232610"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based solely upon a
review of copies of reports filed pursuant to Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;of the
Exchange Act, or written representations from persons required to file such reports,
the Company believes that all filings required to be made were timely made in
accordance with the requirements of the Exchange Act, except as follows:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Altria
Group failed to timely file&nbsp;two Forms&nbsp;4 in December&nbsp;2006
reporting changes in its ownership of Kraft Class&nbsp;A Common Stock. Altria
Group promptly filed the Forms&nbsp;4 reporting such change after discovering
this error.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
February&nbsp;2007, Mr.&nbsp;David A. Brearton, one of the Company&#146;s executive
officers, failed to report a change in his ownership of Kraft Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock due to an internal reporting error (his name was omitted from the
report of vested restricted stock that triggers tax withholding obligations). A
Form&nbsp;4 reporting such change was immediately filed after this error was
found.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Pamela E. King, one of the
Company&#146;s executive officers, failed to report her ownership of 500 shares of
Kraft Class&nbsp;A Common Stock on the Form&nbsp;3 that was filed when she
became an executive officer. A Form&nbsp;5 reporting the additional holdings
was filed in February&nbsp;2007, immediately after this error was found.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">AVAILABILITY OF FORM&nbsp;10-K
AND ANNUAL REPORT TO STOCKHOLDERS<a name="AvailabilityOfForm10kAndAnnualRep_232611"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is providing an
Annual Report to stockholders who receive this Proxy Statement. The Company
will also provide copies of the Annual Report to brokers, dealers, banks,
voting trustees, and their nominees for the benefit of their beneficial owners
of record. Additional copies of the Annual Report, which also contains the
Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 (not including documents incorporated by reference), are available without
charge to stockholders upon written request to the Corporate Secretary, Kraft
Foods&nbsp;Inc., Three Lakes Drive, Northfield, Illinois 60093. You may review
the Company&#146;s filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission by visiting
the Company&#146;s website at www.kraft.com.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">OTHER MATTERS<a name="OtherMatters_232611"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management knows of no other
business that will be presented to the meeting for a vote. If other matters
properly come before the meeting, the persons named as proxies will vote on
them in accordance with their best judgment.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">64</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='64',FILE='C:\fc\71233329342_D11189_1852482\7513-1-ei.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 12 23:34 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2008
ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS<a name="a2008AnnualMeetingOfStockholders_020511"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company presently anticipates that the 2008 Annual Meeting of Stockholders will
be held April&nbsp;22, 2008 or thereabouts.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Article I,
Section&nbsp;4 of the Company&#146;s Amended and Restated By-Laws sets forth the procedures
that a stockholder must follow to present other business at the Annual Meeting.
In summary, in order for a stockholder to present other business at the 2008
Annual Meeting, the stockholder must give notice of the other business to the
Company&#146;s Corporate Secretary. The Corporate Secretary must receive that notice
between October&nbsp;15 and November&nbsp;14, 2007. The notice of other
business must include the information specified in Article&nbsp;I,
Section&nbsp;4 of the Company&#146;s By-Laws.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For a
stockholder to include a proposal in the Company&#146;s 2008 Proxy Statement and
proxy card for the meeting, including pursuant to Rule&nbsp;14a-8 of
Regulation&nbsp;14A of the proxy rules of the Exchange Act, and to present that
proposal at the 2008 Annual Meeting, the Company&#146;s Corporate Secretary must
receive the proposal no later than November&nbsp;14, 2007. The notice of
proposal must also include the information specified in Article&nbsp;I,
Section&nbsp;4 of the Company&#146;s By-laws.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Article&nbsp;II,
Section&nbsp;4 of the Company&#146;s Amended and Restated By-laws sets forth the
procedures a stockholder must follow to nominate directors at the Annual
Meeting. In summary, for a stockholder to nominate a candidate for director at
the 2008 Annual Meeting, notice of the nomination must be received by the
Company&#146;s Corporate Secretary between October&nbsp;15 and November&nbsp;14,
2007. The notice of nomination must include the information specified in
Article&nbsp;II, Section&nbsp;4 the Company&#146;s By-laws.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In each case,
the notice must be timely given to the Company&#146;s Corporate Secretary, Three
Lakes Drive, Northfield, Illinois, 60093.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company will furnish a copy of the Company&#146;s Amended and Restated By-laws
without charge upon written request by any stockholder to the Corporate
Secretary.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exhibit&nbsp;A<a name="Exhibita_054302"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
GUIDELINES<a name="CorporateGovernanceGuidelines_002543"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc.<a name="KraftFoodsinc__002543"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Table of
Contents<a name="TableOfContents_002544"></a></font></b></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" bgcolor="white" style="background:white;border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="20" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:15.0pt;">

  <td width="20" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:15.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No Limitations on Terms</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="29" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-5</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="20" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:15.0pt;">

  Independence</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="29" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-8</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="20" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="2" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="2" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="6" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="1" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="1" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="1" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="571" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="29" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-</font><font face="Times New Roman">1</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='A-1',FILE='C:\Fc\7204350670_P66532CHE_1849712\7513-1-ga.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 00:44 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc.<a name="KraftFoodsinc__232341"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporate Governance
Guidelines<a name="CorporateGovernanceGuidelines_232341"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">A.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>ROLE
AND RESPONSIBILITY OF THE BOARD<a name="A_RoleAndResponsibilityOfTheBoard_232341"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
primary responsibility of the Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) is to foster the
long-term success of the Company, consistent with its fiduciary duty to the
stockholders. The Board has responsibility for establishing broad corporate
policies, setting strategic direction, and overseeing management, which is
responsible for the day-to-day operations of the Company. In fulfilling this
role, each director must exercise his or her good faith business judgment of
the best interests of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">B.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>BOARD
COMPOSITION, STRUCTURE AND POLICIES<a name="B_BoardCompositionStructureAndPol_232341"></a></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><i><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Board
Size</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Nominating and Governance Committee makes
recommendations to the Board concerning the appropriate size of the Board. The
Board believes that the quality of the individuals serving on the Board and the
overall balance of the Board is more important than the number of members,
although the Board believes that there should be a minimum of nine directors to
help ensure the proper functioning of the Board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.&#160;&#160;&#160; <i>Altria Group Nominees</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the terms of a corporate agreement (the &#147;Corporate
Agreement&#148;) entered into between the Company and Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Altria
Group&#148;), so long as Altria owns shares representing 50% or more of the voting
power of the Company&#146;s outstanding Common Stock, Altria has the right to
designate for nomination by the Board three members of the Board, including the
Chairman of the Board. Altria also has the right to fill any vacancy resulting
from an Altria designee ceasing to serve on the Board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.&#160;&#160;&#160; <i>Independence of Directors</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board shall have a
majority of directors who meet the &#147;independence&#148; requirements under New York
Stock Exchange Listing Standards. The Board shall annually make an affirmative
determination as to the independence of each director following a
recommendation by the Nominating and Governance Committee and a review of all
relevant information. The Board has established categorical standards to assist
it in making such determinations. Such standards are set forth in Annex A
hereto.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Annual Election of Directors</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All directors are elected annually by the Company&#146;s
stockholders. Each year the Board recommends a slate of directors for election
by stockholders at the Annual Meeting of Stockholders. The Board&#146;s
recommendations are based on the recommendations of the Nominating and
Governance Committee.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the By-Laws, the
Board may fill vacancies in existing or new director positions. Such directors
elected by the Board serve only until the next Annual Meeting of Stockholders
when they must stand for election by the stockholders. Stockholders who wish to
suggest candidates to the Nominating and Governance Committee for consideration
as directors must submit a written notice to the Corporate Secretary, Kraft
Foods&nbsp;Inc., Three Lakes Drive, Northfield, IL 60093, who will provide the
notice to the Nominating and Governance Committee. The Nominating and
Governance Committee does not distinguish between nominees recommended by
stockholders and other nominees. The Company&#146;s By-Laws set forth the procedures
a stockholder must follow to nominate directors for election at an annual
meeting of stockholders, which are also summarized in our proxy statement each
year.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-</font><font face="Times New Roman">2</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='A-2',FILE='C:\fc\6854642386_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Board Membership Criteria</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subject to the terms of
the corporate agreement with Altria, the Nominating and Governance Committee
works with the Board to determine the appropriate characteristics, skills and
experience for the Board as a whole and its individual members. In evaluating
the suitability of individuals for Board membership, the Nominating and
Governance Committee takes into account many factors, including whether the
individual meets the requirements for independence; the individual&#146;s general
understanding of the various disciplines relevant to the success of a large
publicly traded company in today&#146;s global business environment; the individual&#146;s
understanding of the Company&#146;s global businesses and markets; the individual&#146;s
professional expertise and educational background; and other factors that
promote diversity of views and experience. The Nominating and Governance
Committee evaluates each individual in the context of the Board as a whole,
with the objective of recommending a group of directors that can best
perpetuate the success of the business and represent stockholder interests
through the exercise of sound judgment, using its diversity of experience. In
determining whether to recommend a director for re-election, the Nominating and
Governance Committee also considers the director&#146;s past attendance at meetings
and participation in and contributions to the activities of the Board.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Limitation on Number of Management Directors</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board believes that
it is generally preferable that the Chief Executive Officer be the only member
of management who serves as member of the Board. The Board may from time to
time determine that it is appropriate to nominate additional members of
management to the Board.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Chairman of the Board</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the terms of the Corporate Agreement with
Altria, Altria has the right to designate the Chairman of the Board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8.&#160;&#160;&#160; <i>Change in Primary Employment</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-management and
non-Altria -designated directors who retire or change their primary
employment must tender their resignation to the Nominating and Governance
Committee. The Nominating and Governance Committee shall evaluate the continued
appropriateness of Board membership under the new circumstances and make a
recommendation to the Board as to whether to accept the resignation or not.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Conflicts of Interest</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If a director develops an actual, apparent or
potential conflict of interest, the director should report the matter promptly
to the Nominating and Governance Committee for evaluation and appropriate
resolution.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If a director has a
direct or indirect personal interest in a matter before the Board, the director
shall disclose the interest to the full Board, shall recuse himself or herself
from participation in the discussion, and the matter shall not be approved
unless it receives the affirmative vote of a majority of the directors or the
appropriate committee who have no direct or indirect personal interest in the
matter.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>No Specific
Limitations on Other Board Service</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board does not believe that its members should be
prohibited from serving on boards and committees of other organizations. Each
director is expected to ensure that other commitments do not interfere with the
discharge of his or her duties as a director of the Company. Directors are
expected to inform the Chairman and the Chairman of the Nominating and
Governance Committee upon becoming a director of any other public company or
becoming a member of the audit committee of any other public company. The
Nominating and Governance Committee and the Board will take into account the
nature and extent of an individual&#146;s other commitments when determining whether
it is appropriate to nominate such individual for election or re-election as a
director. Service on boards and committees of other organizations should be
consistent with the Company&#146;s conflict of interest policies. If a member of the
Audit Committee serves on the </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-</font><font face="Times New Roman">3</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='A-3',FILE='C:\fc\6854642386_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">audit committees of more than three public companies,
the Board shall determine whether such simultaneous service would impair the
ability of such member to serve effectively on the Audit Committee.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11.&#160; <i>No Limitations on Terms</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board does not believe in term limits for
directors because they would deprive the Board of directors who have developed,
through valuable experience over time, an increasing insight into the Company and
its operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12.&#160; <i>Retirement Age for Directors</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-employee directors may not stand for re-election
to the Board after they have reached the age of 72, except that the Board may
from time to time ask a non-employee director to stand for election beyond the
age of 72 when it believes that it is in the best interests of stockholders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A management director must resign from the Board upon
ceasing to be an officer of the Company, and in any event, must resign from the
Board upon reaching the age of 65.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.&#160; <i>Director Orientation and Continuing Education</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company provides an orientation process for new
directors, including a review of background material on the Company, a briefing
on key issues facing the Company and meetings with senior management. On a continuing
basis, directors receive presentations on the Company&#146;s strategic and business
plans, financial performance, legal and regulatory matters, Code of Conduct and
compliance programs and other matters. Periodically, the Board meets with
senior management and visits facilities at the Company&#146;s operating companies.
Directors are encouraged to take advantage of continuing education
opportunities that will enhance their ability to fulfill their
responsibilities. The Company will reimburse directors for reasonable costs
incurred in connection with such continuing education.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14.&#160; <i>Director Communications with Third Parties</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board believes that
senior management speaks for the Company and the Chairman speaks for the Board.
Communications about the Company with stockholders, analysts, the press, media
and other constituencies should be made by management. Individual directors may
from time to time meet with or communicate with various constituencies with
which the Company is involved. It is expected that Board members would do this
with the knowledge of management and, absent unusual circumstances, only at the
request of management.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Stockholder
Communications with the Board</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stockholders
who wish to communicate with the Board may do so by writing to Non-Management
Directors, Board of Directors, Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc., Three Lakes Drive,
Northfield, IL 60093 or to Kraft-Board@kraft.com. The non-management
directors have established procedures for the handling of communications from
stockholders and directed the Corporate Secretary to act as their agent in
processing any communications received. All communications that relate to
matters that are within the scope of the responsibilities of the Board and its
committees are to be forwarded to the non-management directors. Communications
that relate to matters that are within the responsibility of one of the Board
committees are also to be forwarded to the chair of the appropriate committee.
Communications that relate to ordinary business matters that are not within the
scope of the Board&#146;s responsibilities, such as consumer complaints, are to be
sent to the appropriate executive. Solicitations, junk mail and obviously
frivolous or inappropriate communications are not to be forwarded, but will be
made available to any non-management director who wishes to review them.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-</font><font face="Times New Roman">4</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='A-4',FILE='C:\fc\6854642386_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">C.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>BOARD
MEETINGS<a name="C_BoardMeetings_232344"></a></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Frequency of Meetings</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board typically holds regular meetings during the
months of January, March, April, June, August, October&nbsp;and December, and
special meetings are held when necessary. The April&nbsp;meeting follows the
Annual Meeting of Stockholders and is the organizational meeting at which
officers and members and chairs of Board committees are elected.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.&#160;&#160;&#160; <i>Strategic Plan Review</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board meets at an offsite location for several
days each year to review the Company&#146;s strategic plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.&#160;&#160;&#160; <i>Attendance at Meetings</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Directors are expected to prepare themselves for and
to attend all Board meetings, the Annual Meeting of Stockholders and the
meetings of the committees on which they serve, with the understanding that on
occasion a director may be unable to attend a meeting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.&#160;&#160;&#160; <i>Information Flow and Distribution of Meeting Materials</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Various materials are distributed to the Board on a
continuing basis throughout the year and reports and presentations are made at
Board and committee meetings to keep the Board informed on an ongoing basis of
the performance of the Company and its businesses, their future plans
(including acquisitions, divestitures and capital expenditures), the various
issues that they face, and new developments. The materials for each Board
meeting are distributed in advance of the meetings to give directors an
opportunity to review such materials prior to the meeting in order to
facilitate active and informed discussion at the meeting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.&#160;&#160;&#160; <i>Selection of Agenda Items</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">An annual planning calendar is prepared for the Board
covering recurring items and for planning purposes. The Chairman determines the
agenda for each meeting of the Board, taking into account the annual planning
calendar, suggestions from other members of the Board and consultation with
senior management, including the Chief Executive Officer.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.&#160;&#160;&#160; <i>Access to Management and Independent Advisors</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Board members have unrestricted access to management.
The Board and each committee of the Board have the authority to retain
independent legal, accounting and other experts and consultants to advise the
Board and the committees as they may deem appropriate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.&#160;&#160;&#160; <i>Executive Sessions</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-management
directors meet in regularly scheduled sessions following each Board meeting
without any members of management being present. At least once each year, the
Board will hold an executive session at which only those directors who meet the
independence standards of the New York Stock Exchange are present. In lieu of a
regularly presiding director, the Chairman presides over the executive sessions
of the non-management directors and the Chairman of the Audit Committee
presides over the executive sessions of the independent directors.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-</font><font face="Times New Roman">5</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='A-5',FILE='C:\fc\6854642386_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">D.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>COMMITTEES
OF THE BOARD<a name="D_CommitteesOfTheBoard_232346"></a></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Committees and Responsibilities</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the Company&#146;s
By-Laws, the Board may establish committees from time to time to assist it in
the performance of its responsibilities: There are currently three Board
committees:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Audit Committee</i>. The committee monitors
the Company&#146;s financial reporting processes and systems of internal accounting
control, the independence and the performance of the independent auditors, and
the performance of the internal auditors.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Compensation Committee. </i>The committee is
responsible for discharging the Board&#146;s responsibilities relating to executive
compensation, including determining the compensation of the Chief Executive
Officer, producing an annual compensation committee report on executive
compensation to be included in the Company&#146;s proxy statement in accordance with
applicable rules&nbsp;and regulations of the Securities and Exchange
Commission, and reviewing the succession plans for the Chief Executive Officer
and other senior executives.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Nominating and Governance Committee. </i>The
committee is responsible for identifying individuals qualified to become Board
members, recommending a slate of nominees for election at each Annual Meeting
of Stockholders, making recommendations to the Board concerning the appropriate
size, function, needs and composition of the Board and its committees,
developing and recommending to the Board the Company&#146;s corporate governance
principles and overseeing the evaluation of the Board and its committees and
management.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A full description of the responsibilities of each of
the committees is set forth in the committee charters that are published on the
Company&#146;s website.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board may, from
time to time, establish or maintain additional committees as it deems necessary
or appropriate.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Membership and Chairs of Committees</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based upon the recommendation of the Nominating and
Governance Committee, the Board elects the members and chairs of each committee
at its annual organizational meeting following the Annual Meeting of
Stockholders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The members of the Audit Committee, Compensation
Committee, and Nominating and Governance Committees shall consist only of those
directors whom the Board determines meet the New York Stock Exchange
independence requirements and who meet the additional requirements for
committee membership of the New York Stock Exchange and any other applicable
laws, rules&nbsp;and regulations and the committee charters. At least one
member of the Audit Committee shall be an &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148; as
such term is defined in regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board does not
favor mandatory rotation of committee assignments or chairs. The Board believes
that experience and continuity are more important than rotation.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Committee Agendas, Meetings and Reports to the Board</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The chair
of each committee, in consultation with the other committee members and with
management, shall set meeting agendas and determine the frequency and length of
committee meetings. Each committee reports its actions and recommendations to
the Board.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-</font><font face="Times New Roman">6</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='A-6',FILE='C:\fc\6854642386_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">E.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>PERFORMANCE
EVALUATION AND SUCCESSION PLANNING<a name="E_PerformanceEvaluationAndSuccess_232347"></a></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Annual CEO Evaluation</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In conjunction with the
Chairman, the Compensation Committee shall establish annual and long-term
financial and strategic goals and objectives for the Chief Executive Officer,
evaluate the performance of the Chief Executive Officer in light of these goals
and objectives, and determine and approve the compensation of the Chief
Executive Officer based on this evaluation. The Compensation Committee will
review with the Board its evaluation of the Chief Executive Officer&#146;s
performance and its determination of the Chief Executive Officer&#146;s
compensation. The Chair of the Compensation Committee will communicate this
evaluation to the Chief Executive Officer.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Succession Planning</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation
Committee is responsible for reviewing and assisting with the development of
executive succession plans, evaluating and making recommendations to the Board
regarding potential candidates to become Chief Executive Officer, and reviewing
candidates to fill other senior executive positions. The Compensation Committee
also recommends to the Board succession plans for the Chief Executive Officer
in the event of an emergency or the retirement of the Chief Executive Officer.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Board and Committee Self-Evaluations</i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Nominating and Governance Committee is responsible for developing and
recommending to the Board and overseeing an annual self-evaluation process for
the Board and for the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee, and the
Nominating and Governance Committee. The Board will discuss the results of the
self-evaluations to determine whether the Board and committees are functioning
effectively and whether any actions should be taken to improve their
effectiveness.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">F.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>BOARD
COMPENSATION<a name="F_BoardCompensation_232347"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation Committee periodically benchmarks non-employee
director compensation against the Compensation Survey Group and general
industry data, considers the appropriateness of the form and amount of non-employee
director compensation and makes recommendations to the Board concerning such
compensation with a view toward attracting and retaining qualified directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board believes that a substantial portion of non-employee
director compensation should consist of equity-based compensation to
assist in aligning directors&#146; interests with the long-term interests of
stockholders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employees
of the Company or of Altria or any of its subsidiaries who serve as directors
shall not receive any additional compensation for service on the Board.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">G.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>CONFIDENTIAL
VOTING<a name="G_ConfidentialVoting_232348"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">It is the
Company&#146;s policy to hold the votes of each stockholder in confidence from
directors, officers and employees except: (a)&nbsp;as necessary to meet
applicable legal requirements and to assert or defend claims for or against the
Company, (b)&nbsp;in case of a contested proxy solicitation, (c)&nbsp;if a
stockholder makes a written comment on the proxy card or otherwise communicates
his or her vote to management, or (d)&nbsp;to allow the independent inspectors
of election to certify the results of the vote. It is also the Company&#146;s policy
to retain an independent tabulator to receive and tabulate the proxies and
independent inspectors of election to certify the results.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-</font><font face="Times New Roman">7</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='A-7',FILE='C:\fc\6854642386_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H.</font></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>REVIEW
OF THESE GUIDELINES<a name="H_ReviewOfTheseGuidelines_232348"></a></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Nominating and Governance
Committee will review these Corporate Governance Guidelines at least annually,
and will report the results of its review and make recommendations to the full
Board as to any changes. The Board has the authority to amend or modify these
Corporate Governance Guidelines.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Annex A<a name="AnnexA_232349"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Categorical Standards
of Director Independence<a name="CategoricalStandardsOfDirectorInd_232349"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A director
is considered independent if the Board makes an affirmative determination after
a review of all relevant information that the director has no material
relationship with the Company. The Board has established the categorical
standards set forth below to assist it in making such determinations.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">1.</font></i><i><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>A director will
not be considered independent if the director:</i></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading -->i.</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">is, or within the last three
  years has been, employed by the Company or any of its subsidiaries;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ii.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">has an immediate family
  member who is, or within the last three years has been, employed as an
  executive officer of the Company or any of its subsidiaries;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">iii.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">receives, or during any
  12&nbsp;months period within the last three years has received, more than
  $100,000 per year in direct compensation from the Company or its subsidiaries
  other than director and committee fees and pension or other forms of deferred
  compensation for prior service (provided such compensation is not contingent
  on continued service);</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">iv.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">has an immediate family
  member who receives, or during any 12&nbsp;months period within the last
  three years has received, more than $100,000 per year in direct compensation
  as an executive employee of the Company or any of its subsidiaries other than
  pension or other forms of deferred compensation (provided such compensation
  is not contingent on continued service);</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">v.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">is a current partner or a
  current employee of the independent auditors of the Company or any of its
  subsidiaries;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">vi.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">has an immediate family
  member who is a current partner or current employee of the independent
  auditors of the Company or any of its subsidiaries, or is a current employee
  of such firm and participates in its audit, assurance, or tax compliance (but
  not tax planning) practice;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
