  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">vii.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">was within the last three
  years (but is no longer) a partner or employee of the independent auditors of
  the Company or any of its subsidiaries and personally worked on the audit of
  the Company or any of its subsidiaries within that time;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">viii.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">has an immediate family
  member who was within the last three years (but is no longer) a partner or
  employee of the independent auditors of the Company or any of its
  subsidiaries and personally worked on the audit of the Company or any of its
  subsidiaries within that time;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ix.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">is or within the last three
  years has been, employed as an executive officer of another company where any
  of the current executive officers of the Company or any of its subsidiaries
  serve, or within the last three years have served, on such other company&#146;s
  compensation committee;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">x.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">has an immediate family
  member who is, or within the last three years has been, employed as an
  executive officer of another company where any of the current executive
  officers of the Company or any of its subsidiaries serve, or within the last
  three years have served, on such other company&#146;s compensation committee;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">xi.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">is a current employee of a
  company that makes payments to, or receives payments from, the Company or its
  subsidiaries in an amount which, in any single fiscal year for the last three
  fiscal years, exceeds the greater of $1&nbsp;million or 2% of such other
  company&#146;s consolidated gross revenues; or</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-</font><font face="Times New Roman">8</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='A-8',FILE='C:\fc\6854642386_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="28" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.1pt;">
  <p align="right" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading -->xii.</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="629" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:471.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">has an immediate family
  member who is a current executive officer of a company that makes payments
  to, or receives payments from, the Company or its subsidiaries in an amount
  which, in any single fiscal year for the last three fiscal years, exceeds the
  greater of $1&nbsp;million or 2% of such other company&#146;s consolidated gross
  revenues.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">2.</font></i><i><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Relationships of
the following types will not be considered material relationships that would
impair a director&#146;s independence:</i></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="24" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.0pt;">
  <p align="right" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading -->i.</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="633" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:474.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">charitable donations or
  pledges made by the Company or its subsidiaries to a charitable organization
  of which a director is, or within the last three year has been, an executive
  officer, director, trustee or the equivalent in an amount that, in any single
  fiscal year, does not exceed the greater of $1&nbsp;million or 2% of such
  charitable organization&#146;s consolidated gross revenues;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="24" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.0pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ii.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="633" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:474.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">commercial relationships in
  which a director (or a member of his or her immediate family) is a director,
  officer, employee or significant stockholder of an entity with which the
  Company has ordinary course business dealings that do not, or with which the
  Company has a commercial banking, investment banking or insurance brokerage
  relationship, in each case that does not, cross the bright-line tests in
  Sections 1&nbsp;(xi) and 1&nbsp;(xii) above and where the director (or
  immediate family member) is not directly responsible for or involved in the
  entity&#146;s business dealings with the Company; or</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="24" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.0pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">iii.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="633" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:474.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">membership in, or
  association with, the same professional association, social, educational,
  fraternal or religious organization, club or institution, as an executive
  officer or another director of the Company;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="24" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.0pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">iv.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="633" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:474.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">service on the board of
  another company at which an executive officer or another director of the
  Company also serves as a board member, except as set forth in Sections 1
  (ix)&nbsp;and 1 (x)&nbsp;above; and</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="24" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.0pt;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">v.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="633" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:474.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">employment by a director at
  another company, or service on the board of another company by a director,
  where the independent auditor for such other company is also the independent
  auditor for the Company.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">Amended as of February&nbsp;26,
2006<a name="AmendedAsOfFebruary262006_232350"></a></font></b></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A-</font><font face="Times New Roman">9</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='A-9',FILE='C:\fc\6854642386_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exhibit&nbsp;B<a name="Exhibitb_054357"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">AUDIT COMMITTEE CHARTER<a name="AuditCommitteeCharter_232824"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc.<a name="KraftFoodsinc__232824"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Audit Committee
Composition and Meetings<a name="AuditCommitteeCompositionAndMeeti_232824"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Audit Committee of the Board of Directors of Kraft
Foods&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Committee&#148;) shall be composed of three or more
non-employee directors who meet the &#147;independence&#148; requirements of the New York
Stock Exchange and applicable laws, rules&nbsp;and regulations for audit
committee membership. All members of the Committee shall be financially
literate, at least one member shall be an &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148; as
defined by the rules&nbsp;and regulations of the Securities and Exchange
Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;), and at least one member of the Committee (who may also
serve as the audit committee financial expert) shall have accounting or related
financial management expertise in accordance with the New York Stock Exchange
listing standards, all as determined in the business judgment of the Board of
Directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of Directors shall elect the members of the
Committee meeting these requirements and designate its Chair at the organizational
meeting of the Board of Directors following the Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
If the Board of Directors does not designate a Chair of the Committee, the
members may designate a Chair by majority vote of the Committee&#146;s members. The
members of the Committee may be removed by the Board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee shall meet at least six times annually
or more frequently as circumstances may require. A majority of the members of
the Committee shall constitute a quorum. The Chair of the Committee, in consultation
with the other Committee members and the Company&#146;s Chief Financial Officer,
shall set meeting agendas. The Committee shall meet separately periodically in
executive session with management, the internal auditors, the independent
auditors, and as a committee to discuss any matters that the Committee or the
persons with whom they meet believe should be discussed. The Corporate
Secretary shall maintain minutes of the meetings of the Committee.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In fulfilling its responsibilities, the Committee
shall have full access to all books, records, facilities and personnel of the
Company and to the services of the independent auditors. The Committee shall
also have the authority to conduct investigations and authority to engage
independent counsel and other advisers, as it determines necessary to carry out
its duties. The Company must provide for appropriate funding, as determined by
the Committee, for payment of (i)&nbsp;compensation to the independent auditors
engaged for the purpose of preparing or issuing an audit report or performing
other audit, review or attest services for the Company, (ii)&nbsp;compensation
to any advisers employed by the Committee, and (iii)&nbsp;ordinary
administrative expenses of the Committee that are necessary or appropriate in
carrying out its duties.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">While the Committee has the
responsibilities and powers set forth in this charter, it is not the duty of
the Committee to plan or conduct audits or to determine that the Company&#146;s
financial statements and disclosures are complete and accurate and are in accordance
with generally accepted accounting principles and applicable rules&nbsp;and
regulations. These are the responsibilities of management and the independent
auditor.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Audit Committee
Authority and Responsibilities<a name="AuditCommitteeAuthorityAndRespons_232825"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee shall oversee the Company&#146;s accounting
and financial reporting processes and audits of its financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee shall assist the Board of Directors in
its oversight of (i)&nbsp;the integrity of the Company&#146;s financial statements
and the Company&#146;s financial reporting processes and systems of internal control
over financial reporting, (ii)&nbsp;the Company&#146;s compliance with legal and
regulatory requirements, (iii)&nbsp;the qualifications, independence, and
performance of the Company&#146;s independent auditors, and (iv)&nbsp;the
performance of the Company&#146;s internal auditors and internal audit function. The
Committee shall perform any other activities consistent with the Company&#146;s
Certificate of Incorporation, By-Laws and governing law as the Committee or the
Board of Directors deems necessary or appropriate.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">B-</font><font face="Times New Roman">1</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='B-1',FILE='C:\fc\685470418_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any of the Committee&#146;s responsibilities designated
herein may be delegated by the Committee to its Chair or another member of the
Committee, unless prohibited by law, regulation or New York Stock Exchange
listing standard.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee shall:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>be directly
responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the
work of the independent auditors (including resolution of disagreements between
management and the independent auditors regarding financial reporting) for the
purpose of preparing or issuing an audit report or performing other audit,
review or attest services for the Company, and the independent auditors shall
report directly to the Committee. In this regard, the Committee shall have the
sole authority to retain and terminate the independent auditors of the Company
(subject, if applicable, to stockholder ratification), including the sole
authority to approve all audit engagement fees and terms and all permissible
non-audit services to be provided by the independent auditors. The Committee
shall pre-approve the audit and non-audit services to be provided by the
Company&#146;s independent auditors. The Committee may, from time to time, delegate
its authority to pre-approve such services to one or more Committee members, provided
that such designees present any such approvals to the full Committee at the
next Committee meeting;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review and discuss
with the independent auditors their audit procedures, including the audit plan
and its scope with respect to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review and discuss
with the independent auditors and with management the results of the annual
audit of the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements and the Company&#146;s
interim financial results, in each case prior to the filing or distribution
thereof, including (i)&nbsp;the Company&#146;s disclosures under &#147;Management&#146;s
Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#148; and (ii)&nbsp;any
appropriate matters regarding accounting principles, practices and judgments
and the independent auditors&#146; opinion as to the quality thereof and any items
required to be communicated to the Committee by the independent auditors in
accordance with standards established and amended from time to time by the
American Institute of Certified Public Accountants;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review and discuss
with management, the independent auditors, and the internal auditors the
quality and adequacy of the Company&#146;s financial reporting processes, internal
controls over financial reporting and disclosure controls and procedures,
including whether there are any significant deficiencies in the design or
operation of such processes, controls and procedures, material weaknesses in
such processes, controls and procedures, any corrective action taken with
regard to such deficiencies and weaknesses and any fraud involving management
or other employees with a significant role in such processes, controls and
procedures;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>on at least an
annual basis, evaluate the independent auditors&#146; qualifications, performance
and independence, and present its conclusions and recommendations with respect
to the independent auditors to the Board of Directors. As part of such
evaluation, the Committee shall:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>obtain
and review a report from the Company&#146;s independent auditors describing (i)&nbsp;the
independent auditors&#146; internal quality-control procedures, (ii)&nbsp;any
material issues raised by (a)&nbsp;the most recent internal quality-control
review or peer review of the auditing firm, or (b)&nbsp;any inquiry or
investigation by governmental or professional authorities, within the preceding
five years, regarding one or more independent audits carried out by the
independent auditors, and any steps taken to deal with any such issues, and (iii)&nbsp;all
relationships between the independent auditors and the Company;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review
and evaluate the lead audit partner of the independent auditors;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>in
addition to assuring the regular rotation of the lead partner(s)&nbsp;as
required by law, consider whether the independent auditing firm should be
rotated, so as to assure continuing auditor independence; and</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">B-</font><font face="Times New Roman">2</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='B-2',FILE='C:\fc\685470418_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>obtain the opinion of
management and the internal auditors of the independent auditors&#146; performance;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>establish clear
policies for the Company&#146;s hiring of current or former employees of the
independent auditors;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>evaluate the
performance of the Company&#146;s internal audit function, and review and discuss
with the internal auditors and independent auditors the internal audit plan,
budget, activities, responsibilities and staffing of the internal audit
organization;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review and discuss
with the independent auditors any audit problems or difficulties and management&#146;s
response thereto, including (i)&nbsp;any restrictions on the scope of the
independent auditors&#146; activities or access to required information, (ii)&nbsp;any
significant disagreements with management, (iii)&nbsp;any accounting
adjustments that were noted or proposed by the independent auditors but were &#147;passed&#148;
(as immaterial or otherwise), (iv)&nbsp;any communications between the audit
team and the independent auditors&#146; national office respecting significant
auditing or accounting issues presented by the engagement, and (v)&nbsp;any &#147;management&#148;
or &#147;internal control&#148; letter issues, or proposed to be issued, by the
independent auditors to the Company;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review and discuss
with management, the internal auditors and the independent auditors, in
separate meetings if the Audit Committee deems them appropriate:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
analyses or other written communications prepared by management and/or the
independent auditors setting forth significant financial reporting issues and
judgments made in connection with the preparation of the financial statements,
including analyses of the effects of alternative GAAP methods on the financial
statements;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
critical accounting policies and practices of the Company;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
effect of regulatory and accounting initiatives, as well as off-balance-sheet
structures, on the Company; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>major issues regarding
accounting principles and financial statement presentations, including any
significant changes in the Company&#146;s selection or application of accounting
principles, and major issues as to the adequacy of the Company&#146;s internal
controls over financial reporting and any special steps adopted in light of
material control deficiencies;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>generally discuss the
type and presentation of (i)&nbsp;information to be included in earnings press
releases (in particular any use of &#147;pro forma&#148; or &#147;adjusted&#148; non-GAAP
information) and (ii)&nbsp;any financial information and earnings guidance
provided to analysts and rating agencies;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review and discuss the
Company&#146;s guidelines and policies with respect to risk assessment and risk
management, including the Company&#146;s major financial risk exposures and the
steps that have been taken to monitor and control such exposures;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>at least annually, verify
that the Company&#146;s internal auditors, independent auditors or other officials
have thoroughly checked the accuracy and propriety of the named executive
officers&#146; expense accounts and perquisites, including their use of corporate
assets;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>meet at least annually
with the Company&#146;s Chief Compliance Officer to review the application and
administration of the Code of Conduct and Code of Business Conduct and Ethics
for Directors and the procedures for identifying, pursuing and investigating
any alleged violation of such codes, review and make determinations on
exceptions to such codes and provide counsel to the Chief Compliance Officer
with respect to actual and alleged violations of such codes;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>establish procedures for (i)&nbsp;the
receipt, retention and treatment of complaints received by the Company
regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or audit matters, and (ii)&nbsp;the
confidential, anonymous submission by employees of the Company of concerns
regarding questionable accounting or auditing </p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">B-</font><font face="Times New Roman">3</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='B-3',FILE='C:\fc\685470418_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">matters, and shall review any
significant complaints regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or
audit matters received pursuant to such procedures;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review and assess the
adequacy of this Charter annually and submit any recommended changes to the
Board of Directors for its approval;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>recommend to the Board of
Directors whether the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements should be
accepted for inclusion in the Company&#146;s annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">17.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>prepare a report of the
Committee to stockholders to be included in the Company&#146;s annual proxy
statement as required by the SEC, and cause to be filed with the New York Stock
Exchange any reports that may be required with respect to the Committee;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review and approve all
material transactions between the Company and its principal stockholder, and
the other subsidiaries of its principal shareholder;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>at least annually,
evaluate its own performance and report to the Board of Directors on such
evaluation;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review disclosures made
by the Company&#146;s principal executive officer(s)&nbsp;and principal financial
officer(s)&nbsp;regarding compliance with their certification obligations under
the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and the rules&nbsp;promulgated thereunder,
including the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and internal
controls for financial reporting, and evaluations thereof; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>report the activities of
the Committee to the Board of Directors on a regular basis and review with the
Board of Directors any issues that arise with respect to the quality or
integrity of the Company&#146;s financial statements, the Company&#146;s compliance with
legal and regulatory requirements, the performance and independence of the
Company&#146;s independent auditors, and the performance of the internal audit
function.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">Amended as of February&nbsp;26,
2006<a name="AmendedAsOfFebruary262006_232828"></a></font></b></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">B-</font><font face="Times New Roman">4</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='B-4',FILE='C:\fc\685470418_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exhibit&nbsp;C<a name="Exhibitc_054436"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">COMPENSATION COMMITTEE
CHARTER<a name="CompensationCommitteeCharter_222531"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The Compensation Committee of the
Board of Directors of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Committee&#148;) </font>shall
discharge the Board&#146;s responsibilities relating to compensation for executives
and independent directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee shall be
composed of three or more directors determined by the Board of Directors to be:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>&#147;Independent&#148; for
purposes of the New York Stock Exchange listing standards;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>&#147;Non-employee
directors&#148; for purposes of Rule&nbsp;16b-3 under the Securities and
Exchange Act of 1934; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iii)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>&#148;Outside director&#148; for
purposes of Section&nbsp;162(m)&nbsp;of the Internal Revenue Code.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of Directors shall appoint the members of
the Committee, meeting these requirements, and designate the Committee&#146;s Chair.
If the Board of Directors does not designate a Committee Chair, the members may
designate a Chair by majority vote. The members of the Committee may be removed
by the Board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee shall meet as often as it deems is
appropriate to carry out its responsibilities. The Chair of the Committee, in
consultation with the Company&#146;s Executive Vice President, Global Human
Resources, shall set meeting agendas. The Committee shall report its actions
and recommendations to the Board of Directors. The Corporate Secretary shall
maintain minutes of the Committee meetings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In fulfilling its responsibilities, the Committee
shall have full access to the Company&#146;s books, records, facilities and
personnel. The Committee shall have the authority to conduct investigations and
retain, approve fees and other retention terms, and terminate compensation
consultants, independent counsel, and other advisors. The Company shall provide
appropriate funding, as determined by the Committee, for payment of (i)&nbsp;compensation
to any advisors employed by the Committee, and (ii)&nbsp;ordinary
administrative expenses of the Committee that are necessary or appropriate in
carrying out its duties.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee may delegate any of its responsibilities
to its Chair or another member of the Committee, unless prohibited by law,
regulation or New York Stock Exchange listing standard.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In carrying out its
duties, the Committee shall:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">e</font>stablish
the Company&#146;s executive compensation philosophy;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>determine the group
of companies used to benchmark executive and Director compensation;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>assess the
appropriateness and competitiveness of the Company&#146;s executive compensation
programs, including among other elements, severance programs and executive
retirement income design.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review and approve
goals and objectives of the Chief Executive Officer (&#147;CEO&#148;), evaluate the
performance of the CEO in light of these goals and objectives and, based upon
its evaluation, determine both the elements and amounts of the CEO&#146;s
compensation, as well as perquisites;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">5.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review Management&#146;s recommendations for,
and approve the compensation of, the CEO&#146;s executive direct reports;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">6.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">determine
annual incentive compensation, equity awards a</font>nd other long-term
incentive awards granted under the Company&#146;s equity and long-term incentive
plans to eligible participants<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">7.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>determine policies governing option and
other stock grants;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>make
recommendations to the Board with respect to incentive plans requiring
stockholder approval; approve eligibility for and design of executive
compensation programs implemented under stockholder-approved plans.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">C-1</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='C-1',FILE='C:\fc\6854713674_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>monitor compliance
by executives with the Company&#146;s stock ownership guidelines;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>oversee the management
development and succession planning process (including succession planning for
emergencies) for the CEO and the CEO&#146;s executive direct reports and, as
appropriate, evaluate potential candidates;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">11.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>periodically assess the appropriateness of and
advise the Board regarding the compensation of independent Directors for
service on the Board and its Committees<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">12.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review<b>  </b>and discuss
with management the Company&#146;s Compensation Discussion and Analysis; produce and
approve <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">the Committee&#146;s annual report for
inclusion in the Company&#146;s annual proxy statement;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>annually evaluate the
Committee&#146;s performance, including reviewing the Committee&#146;s charter, and
report to the Board on such evaluation;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>perform
such other duties and responsibilities as are consistent with the purpose of
the Committee and as the Board or the Committee shall deem appropriate.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">Amended as of January&nbsp;29, 2007</font></b></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">C-2</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='C-2',FILE='C:\fc\6854713674_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:47 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exhibit&nbsp;D<a name="Exhibitd_054512"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOMINATING AND
GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE CHARTER</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc.<a name="KraftFoodsinc__223354"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nominating and
Governance Committee Composition and Meetings<a name="NominatingAndGovernanceCommitteeC_223354"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Nominating and Governance Committee of the Board
of Directors of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Committee&#148;) shall be composed of
three or more directors who the Board of Directors determines are &#147;independent&#148;
as that term is defined by the New York Stock Exchange listing standards.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of Directors shall elect the members of the
Committee meeting these requirements and designate its Chair at the
organizational meeting of the Board of Directors following the Annual Meeting
of Stockholders. If the Board of Directors does not designate a Chair of the
Committee, the members may designate a Chair by majority vote of the Committee&#146;s
members. The members of the Committee may be removed by the Board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee shall meet as often as it deems is
appropriate to carry out its responsibilities. A majority of the members of the
Committee shall constitute a quorum. The Chair of the Committee, in
consultation with the other Committee members and the Company&#146;s Corporate
Secretary, shall set meeting agendas. The Committee shall report its actions
and recommendations to the Board of Directors. The Corporate Secretary shall
maintain minutes of the meetings of the Committee.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In fulfilling its
responsibilities, the Committee shall have full access to all books, records,
facilities and personnel of the Company. The Committee shall also have the
authority to conduct investigations and retain any search firm assisting the
Committee in identifying director candidates, independent counsel, and other
advisers, as it determines necessary to carry out its duties, including sole
authority to retain and terminate any search firm to be used to identify director
candidates, and to approve such firm&#146;s fees and other retention terms. The
Company must provide for appropriate funding, as determined by the Committee,
for payment of (i)&nbsp;compensation to any advisers employed by the Committee,
and (ii)&nbsp;ordinary administrative expenses of the Committee that are
necessary or appropriate in carrying out its duties.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nominating and
Governance Committee Responsibilities<a name="NominatingAndGovernanceCommitteeR_223355"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee shall (i)&nbsp;identify qualified
individuals to become Board members consistent with criteria approved by the
Board, (ii)&nbsp;make recommendations to the Board concerning the appropriate
size, function, needs and composition of the Board and its Committees, and (iii)&nbsp;advise
the Board on corporate governance matters, including developing and
recommending to the Board the Company&#146;s corporate governance principles.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any of the Committee&#146;s responsibilities designated
herein may be delegated by the Committee to its Chair or another member of the
Committee, unless prohibited by law, regulation or New York Stock Exchange
listing standard.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee shall:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review the
qualifications of candidates for director suggested by Board members,
stockholders, management and others in accordance with criteria established by
the Board;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>consider the
performance and suitability of incumbent directors in determining whether to
nominate them for reelection;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>recommend to the
Board a slate of nominees for election or reelection to the Board at each
annual meeting of stockholders;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>recommend to the
Board candidates to be elected to the Board as necessary to fill vacancies and
newly created directorships;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>make
recommendations to the Board as to determinations of director independence;</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">D-1</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='D-1',FILE='C:\fc\685473583_D10466_1836852\7513-1-gq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar  9 05:48 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>recommend to the
Board a retirement age for directors;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>make
recommendations to the Board concerning the function, composition and structure
of the Board and its Committees, as well as the frequency and content of Board
meetings;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>recommend to the
Board directors to serve as members of each Committee, as well as candidates to
fill vacancies created on any Committee of the Board;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>evaluate any
Compensation Committee interlocks among Board members and executive officers;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>develop and recommend to
the Board a set of corporate governance principles and to review and recommend
changes to those principles, on an annual basis;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>at least annually, review
the Code of Conduct and Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Directors to
evaluate their content and effectiveness and to recommend changes to or
enhancement of these codes;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>meet at least annually
with the Company&#146;s Chief Compliance Officer to review the operation of and
compliance with the Code of Conduct and the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics
for Directors;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>on an annual basis, report
the results of the Committee&#146;s review of the Code of Conduct and Code of
Business Conduct and Ethics for Directors to the Board along with any
recommended changes to these codes;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>advise and make
recommendations to the Board on corporate governance matters, to the extent
these matters are not the responsibility of other Committees;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>develop and recommend to
the Board an annual self-evaluation process for the Board;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>oversee the evaluation of
the Board;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">17.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>review and evaluate
opportunities for Board members to engage in continuing education;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>evaluate the Committee&#146;s
performance at least annually and report to the Board on such evaluation;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>periodically review and
assess the adequacy of this charter and recommend any proposed changes to the
Board for approval; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>perform
such other duties and responsibilities as are consistent with the purpose of
the Committee and as the Board or the Committee shall deem appropriate.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">Amended as of January&nbsp;29, 2007</font></b></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">D-2</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS ROBERT M. SCHAEBERLE TECHNOLOGY CENTER</font></b></p>

HANOVER, NJ)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">From Manhattan&nbsp;&amp;
Northeast</font></u></i></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">George Washington Bridge</font></u></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">to I-80.&#160; West to</font></b></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">Exit 48 (Pinebrook/Montville). Turn
</font></b>left<font style="font-weight:normal;"> onto Hook Mountain
Road, then </font>right<font style="font-weight:normal;"> onto Bloomfield Ave.
for .4 miles to New Road. Turn </font>left<font style="font-weight:normal;"> on
New Road and go across Route 46 and then over the top of I-280. New Road
becomes Ridgedale Avenue. Proceed to the first traffic light and turn </font>left<font style="font-weight:normal;"> onto Eagle Rock Ave. Go .6 miles and make a right
at the traffic light onto River Road. Go 1.6 miles and our entrance is on your </font>right<font style="font-weight:normal;">.</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Lincoln Tunnel</font></u>
</b><font style="font-weight:normal;">to the NJ Turnpike South. Take the first
Exit (15W) and follow Route 280 West. Take Route 280 West to Exit 4A
(Eisenhower Parkway). Take Eisenhower Parkway South and at the first light turn
</font>right<font style="font-weight:normal;"> onto Eagle Rock Avenue. At the
next light turn </font>left<font style="font-weight:normal;"> onto River Road.
Drive 1.6 miles to the Kraft entrance on your </font>right<font style="font-weight:normal;">.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">From the
West</font></u></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I-80 East to Exit 47A&#160; I-280 East (The Oranges&nbsp;&amp;
Newark). I-280 East to Exit 1 (Edwards Rd./New Rd.). At the traffic light
turn <b>right</b> onto East Edwards Road. East
Edwards Road becomes Ridgedale Ave. Proceed to the first traffic light and make
a <b>left</b> onto Eagle Rock Ave. Go .6 miles
and make a <b>right</b> at the traffic light onto
River Road. Go 1.6 miles and our entrance is on your <b>right</b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">From the South</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Route 287 North to Exit 39 (Route 10 Dover&nbsp;&amp;
Whippany). After exiting bear to your <b>right</b> and
follow sign for Route 10 East (Whippany) for 3.5 miles to Mt. Pleasant
Ave.,&#160; (Ed Carney Ford dealership on your
<b>right</b>). A sign will read &#147;To River
Rd.&nbsp;&amp; Okner Pkwy.&#148;<b>&#160; </b>Bear <b>right </b>onto
Mt. Pleasant Ave. Follow Mt. Pleasant Ave. for .5 miles past the 2nd light and
turn <b>left </b>onto River Rd. Go .7 miles to
Kraft entrance on your <b>left.</b></font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">From the
North</font></u></i></b></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">Route 287 South to Exit 39A (Route
10 East Whippany). Follow Route 10 East for 3.5 miles to Mt. Pleasant Ave. (Ed
Carney Ford dealership on your </font></b>right<font style="font-weight:normal;">). A sign will read &#147;To River Rd.&nbsp;&amp; Okner Pkwy.&#148;&#160; Bear </font>right<font style="font-weight:normal;"> onto Mt. Pleasant Ave. Follow Mt. Pleasant Ave. for .5 miles past the
2nd light and turn </font>left<font style="font-weight:normal;"> onto River
Road. Go .7 miles to the Kraft entrance on your </font>left<font style="font-weight:normal;">.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">From La
Guardia Airport</font></u></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Grand Central Parkway West, across the Triborough
bridge to I-87 West (Major Deegan Expressway). South on I-95 across
the George Washington Bridge to I-80 West. Follow I-80 West to Exit
48 (Pinebrook/ Montville). Turn <b>left </b>onto Hook
Mountain Road, then <b>right</b> onto
Bloomfield Ave. for .4 miles to New Road. Turn <b>left</b>
on New Road and go across Route 46 and then over the top of I-280. New
Road becomes Ridgedale Avenue. Proceed to the first traffic light and turn <b>left </b>onto Eagle Rock Ave. Go .6 miles and then make a <b>right</b> at the traffic light onto River Road. Go 1.6 miles and
our entrance is on your <b>right.</b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">From Morristown Airport</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exit airport and turn<b> left</b>
onto Route 510 East (Columbia Turnpike). Travel 1.6 miles and at the 3rd light
make a <b>left </b>onto James Street. At the next
light make a <b>left</b> turn onto Ridgedale Avenue.
Travel 1.6 miles and at the 3rd light make a <b>right</b>
onto Route 10. Follow Route 10 East for .8 miles to Mt. Pleasant Ave. (Ed
Carney Ford dealership on your <b>right)</b>. A sign
will read &#147;To River Rd.&nbsp;&amp; Okner Pkwy.&#148;&#160;
Bear <b>right</b> onto Mt. Pleasant Ave.
Follow Mt. Pleasant Ave. for .5 miles past the 2nd light and turn <b>left</b> onto River Road. Go .7 miles to Kraft entrance on your <b>left</b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">From
Newark Airport</font></u></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I -78 West to Exit 48 Route 24 West
(Springfield/Morristown). Proceed on route 24 West and take Exit 7C (JFK
Parkway, Livingston/Caldwell). At the 5th light turn <b>left</b>
on South Orange Ave. Follow South Orange Ave. for 1.6 miles to the 4th light
and turn <b>right</b> onto Eisenhower Parkway. Follow
Eisenhower Parkway for .9 to the 2nd light turn <b>left</b>
onto Walnut St. Follow Walnut St. for .6 miles and turn <b>left </b>at
the light onto Route 10 West. On Route 10 West go .8 miles to the 2nd light and
turn <b>right</b> onto River Road. Go .6 miles to
the Kraft entrance on your <b>left</b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LOST?</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If at any time you become lost or need additional
directions, please call our Security Department at <b>(973) 503-3897</b>.</font></p>

</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">
